programme.title: Na cenzurowanym
Master of the Classe
programme.desc: Berry (Sébastien Chassagne) ma 35 lat i dopiero niedawno dostał pracę jako stażysta w gimnazjum. Jego marzenie o stabilnym zatrudnieniu zostaje poddane próbie. Pewnego dnia ma się odbyć inspekcja jego lekcji, której wynik zadecyduje o tym, czy mężczyzna zdobędzie stałą posadę.

credits.actor: Sébastien Chassagne
Séverine Poupin

programme.title: Wojowniczka
Pompon Girl
programme.desc: Ava (Pénélope-Rose Léveque) pracuje jako klaun. Jest zabawna oraz pewna siebie. Pewnej nocy, kiedy wraca do domu z burleskowego show ze swoimi przyjaciółmi, napotkany mężczyzna prowokuje ich i obraża. Dziewczyna postanawia się bronić. Odpowiada na zaczepki napastnika. W wyniku konfrontacji zostaje pobita. Twierdzi, że wszystko jest w porządku aż do momentu, gdy dowiaduje się o czymś ważnym - podczas ataku była w ciąży.

credits.actor: Pénélope Lévêque
Félicie Baille
Julien Drion
Bruno Clairefond

programme.title: Rączki
Les petites mains
programme.desc: Leo (Emile Moulron Lejeune) ma 1,5 roku i jest synem dyrektora zakładu chemicznego. Kiedy zatrudnione tam osoby dowiadują się, że fabryka ma być zamknięta pracownik Bruno (Jan Hammenecker) porywa dziecko, by prowadzić negocjacje.

programme.title: Niepospolita
programme.desc: Rok 1939. Pisarz Tadeusz Dołęga-Mostowicz (Patryk Szwichtenberg) podróżuje po Polsce ze swoją asystentką Dianą (Agata Różycka). Przeprowadza wywiady z ludźmi, którzy osiągnęli sukces w różnych dziedzinach. Na swojej drodze spotyka m.in. Melchiora Wańkowicza (Marek Karpowicz), Janusza Kusocińskiego, Eugeniusza Kwiatkowskiego i Hankę Ordonównę.

programme.title: Tamtej nocy
programme.desc: Zuzanna Szwarc (Hanna Konarowska), mama kilkuletniej dziewczynki, pracuje jako kuratorka sztuki. Pewnego wieczoru widzi napad. Dwóch mężczyzna atakuje chłopaka. Zuza nie pozostaje obojętna i stara się go obronić. Kiedy na miejsce przybywa policja, to jednak ona, nie sprawcy pobicia, zostaje aresztowana.

programme.title: II koncert na wiolonczelę i orkiestrę
programme.desc: Pasją okulisty Macieja Gasika jest muzyka. W trakcie jednego z koncertów mężczyzna doznaje udaru mózgu. Staje się więźniem własnego ciała. Postanawia się nie poddawać i zawalczyć o swoją godność oraz wolność. Film na podstawie prawdziwej historii. Scenariusz stworzono do koncertu wiolonczelowego Pawła Mykietyna.

programme.title: We mnie
programme.desc: Sandra (Małgorzata Gorol) świętuje swój wieczór panieński. Zbliża się dzień ślubu, ale przedtem musi poddać się aborcji - płód ma wady genetyczne. Do szpitala jedzie z nią narzeczony. Z każdą kolejną minutą mężczyzna wydaje się Sandrze coraz bardziej obcy. Po zabiegu kobieta postanawia szczerze z nim porozmawiać.

Maciej Stuhr, Magdalena Cielecka, Michalina Łabacz, Eliza Rycembel, Zofia Wichłacz, Aleksandra Popławska, Robert Gonera, Piotr Głowacki, Krzysztof Pieczyński

programme.title: Szukając Ingmara Bergmana
programme.desc: Sylwetka legendy kina i teatru. Margarethe von Trotta opowiada o dokonaniach szwedzkiego reżysera Ingmara Bergmana. Wnikliwie analizuje najważniejsze sceny z jego filmów, a także kluczowe wątki powtarzające się w całej twórczości autora dramatu "Siódma pieczęć". Von Trotta odnosi się także do miejsc ważnych dla biografii reżysera. W filmie głos zabierają również współpracownicy szwedzkiego mistrza oraz młodsze pokolenie filmowców, dla których dokonania Bergmana są stałym źródłem inspiracji.

credits.actor: Russell Tovey, Amrita Acharia, Bertie Carvel, Tim Plester, Alex Boxall, Lee Byford, Chirague Amarchande, Christie Amery, Amanda Edwards

programme.title: Ma saison préférée
Moja ulubiona pora roku
Ma saison préférée
programme.desc:
Ma saison préférée: Directed by André Téchiné. With Catherine Deneuve, Daniel Auteuil, Marthe Villalonga, Jean-Pierre Bouvier. Old woman Berthe leaves her house to live in her daugter Emilie's one. Emilie and her brother Antoine have fallen out three years ago and have not seen each other since, but Emilie invites him for Christmas. Memories will come up, and will be depicted both Berthe's destiny and the strange relationship between Emilie and Antoine." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107471/","name":"Ma saison préférée","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0NzE2MzA2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDc3NTkwMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Old woman Berthe leaves her house to live in her daugter Emilie's one. Emilie and her brother Antoine have fallen out three years ago and have not seen each other since, but Emilie invites him for Christmas. Memories will come up, an","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107471/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"WilliamCKH"},"dateCreated":"2007-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great film!","reviewBody":"I first saw this film in my mid 20's and realized in hindsight that is was probably the first "adult" film I'd ever seen. These were adults coping with the realities of life, kids, marriage, relationships, an aging mother, death, etc. and not living life in an artificial, adolescent way.

The script is fascinating in that it contains so many wonderful, adult scenes. Some which come to mind immediately are: 

When the mother is talking to herself by the swimming pool, Deneuve comes in saying "why didn't you turn on the light maman?", "Are you afraid I might break something" the mother says "No, it's just that you don't know the house and you may hurt yourself", Deneuve answers. The dialogue is so strong in that you get a point of view from all characters, yet other characters see things in a totally different way and they are all valid. 

The conversation between Bruno and Emilie after his fight with Antoine about how she thinks Bruno's aged badly. How he sees their relationship and gone badly and in contrast how she sees it.

the conversations between Antoine and Emilie about putting their mother in a nursing home, how she always has to find the solutions to things and when she tries, he criticizes and she breaks down crying.

the point made by their mother at the nursing home regarding her children and modernity. How the children have grown up modern as they had wished but this curse of modernity has led them to put their aging mother into this home.

The way the mother talks so frankly about the grandchildren,"she taps on that damn piano all day, and the boy, a real half-wit." 

the close bond between her and Antoine "you don't have to fake sleeping maman, it's only me"

IMDb data; ttnr: 0107471, Title: Ma saison préférée, --- Description: Ma saison préférée: Directed by André Téchiné. With Catherine Deneuve, Daniel Auteuil, Marthe Villalonga, Jean-Pierre Bouvier. Old woman Berthe leaves her house to live in her daugter Emilie's one. Emilie and her brother Antoine have fallen out three years ago and have not seen each other since, but Emilie invites him for Christmas. Memories will come up, and will be depicted both Berthe's destiny and the strange relationship between Emilie and Antoine." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107471/","name":"Ma saison préférée","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0NzE2MzA2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDc3NTkwMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Old woman Berthe leaves her house to live in her daugter Emilie's one. Emilie and her brother Antoine have fallen out three years ago and have not seen each other since, but Emilie invites him for Christmas. Memories will come up, an","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107471/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"WilliamCKH","dateCreated":"2007-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great film!","reviewBody":"I first saw this film in my mid 20's and realized in hindsight that is was probably the first "adult" film I'd ever seen. These were adults coping with the realities of life, kids, marriage, relationships, an aging mother, death, etc. and not living life in an artificial, adolescent way.

The script is fascinating in that it contains so many wonderful, adult scenes. Some which come to mind immediately are: 

When the mother is talking to herself by the swimming pool, Deneuve comes in saying "why didn't you turn on the light maman?", "Are you afraid I might break something" the mother says "No, it's just that you don't know the house and you may hurt yourself", Deneuve answers. The dialogue is so strong in that you get a point of view from all characters, yet other characters see things in a totally different way and they are all valid. 

The conversation between Bruno and Emilie after his fight with Antoine about how she thinks Bruno's aged badly. How he sees their relationship and gone badly and in contrast how she sees it.

the conversations between Antoine and Emilie about putting their mother in a nursing home, how she always has to find the solutions to things and when she tries, he criticizes and she breaks down crying.

the point made by their mother at the nursing home regarding her children and modernity. How the children have grown up modern as they had wished but this curse of modernity has led them to put their aging mother into this home.

The way the mother talks so frankly about the grandchildren,"she taps on that damn piano all day, and the boy, a real half-wit." 

the close bond between her and Antoine "you don't have to fake sleeping maman, it's only me"

I also love the piece of dialogue, after the mother's funeral, where Emilie has been separated from the family and you feel it's time she goes back home and instead of announcing anything, apologizing or trying to get back to the family's good graces, she turns to her husband Bruno as a matter of factly and says "Do we have enough eggs at home?"

Brilliant writing, brilliant dialogue, superb acting. I highly recommend this truly adult movie. Wish they'd make more like this.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2004,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1993-05-14","keywords":"three word title,first person title,male objectification,male rear nudity,bare butt","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000366/","name":"Catherine Deneuve","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000809/","name":"Daniel Auteuil","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0897811/","name":"Marthe Villalonga"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029242/","name":"André Téchiné"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072956/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022244/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094726/","name":"Pascal Bonitzer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029242/","name":"André Téchiné"],"duration":"PT2H7M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: S*P*Y*S
Szpiegomania
S*P*Y*S
programme.desc:
S*P*Y*S: Directed by Irvin Kershner. With Elliott Gould, Donald Sutherland, Zouzou, Joss Ackland. Two spies end up being chased by the CIA, the KGB, and a group of anarchists after a botched mission invoked an unwritten "corpse for a corpse" pact." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0072107/","name":"S*P*Y*S","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2I1YTUzNDAtY2UyYS00NWQ5LWJjYjUtMmUxNGQzYWFjMzQ5L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzc5MjA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two spies end up being chased by the CIA, the KGB, and a group of anarchists after a botched mission invoked an unwritten "corpse for a corpse" pact.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0072107/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"spookyrat1"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"This Was Screened at Cannes???","reviewBody":"Second lead pairing of Elliot Gould and Donald Sutherland (Little Murders saw them together, but with Sutherland in a support role) after the wonderful MASH in what was meant to be some sort of funny spy spoof. Alas, there is no Altmann magic with SPYS and this one sinks like the proverbial stone.

They play a mismatched spy pair who are forced to bond when sold down the river by their various agencies and thereafter chase after some micro-dots. The two still appear to have a kind of improvisational energy, but the material they are dished up to deal with, wouldn't pass muster in an average Get Smart episode. I have to say that I'm surprised the usually very competent direction of Irvin Kershner seems to have gone completely walkabout during the making of this feature. Poorly choreographed and lit action and slapstick scenes! It's difficult to believe this is the same bloke who helmed The Empire Strikes Back 6 years later. SPYS is also lumbered with a terribly annoying musical soundtrack.

In terms of laughs most discerning viewers should find any of the Roger Moore Bond entries much more amusing. And as for spoofs, the later arriving Austin Powers or Johnny English (hell, even the Casino Royale with Peter Sellers) have it all over this clunker. I would love to have been a fly on the wall to see how SPYS was received at Cannes.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":954,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1974-09-05","keywords":"hare krishna,espionage,scene during opening credits,scene during closing credits,paris france","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000661/","name":"Donald Sutherland"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001285/","name":"Elliott Gould"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958088/","name":"Zouzou"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0449984/","name":"Irvin Kershner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0032182/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0067477/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0119027/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0169549/","name":"Lawrence J. Cohen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0293391/","name":"Fred Freeman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0549393/","name":"Malcolm Marmorstein"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: London Town
London Town
programme.desc:
London Town: Directed by Derrick Borte. With Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Daniel Huttlestone, Dougray Scott, Natascha McElhone. In '70s London, a 14 year-old boy is introduced to the Clash by his estranged mother. It changes his life forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1724597/","name":"London Town","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3NjU2MjYzOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTk4NzgwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In '70s London, a 14 year-old boy is introduced to the Clash by his estranged mother. It changes his life forever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1724597/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"subxerogravity"},"dateCreated":"2016-10-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cool first hand story about a kid who gets introduced to The Clash (in more ways than one)","reviewBody":"I really liked Jonathan Rhys Meyers in it as Joe Strummer. It was fun to see him play a real lively character as the front man of The Clash.

The movie itself is more about how a boy named Shay is influenced by the music of the Clash while going through some hard times. His really hot mom (played by Natascha McElhone) left the family to live the life she wanted, while his father (Played by Dougray Scott), plays the classic stereotype of an adult who forgot what it was like to be young and is shifting too much responsibility on his son. 

London Town is greatly similar to another Coming-of-Age film, Sing Street (which is a little better), as Shay allows a crush on a punk rock girl to greatly influence his walk down the path of punk, which leads him to meeting Joe Strummer. 

The film's formula is very direct, and it's focus on punk rock makes it a perfect persona of the early days of the genre. It's a love letter to The Clash any fan would enjoy.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2285,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2016-10-07","keywords":"the clash,pantyhose,miniskirt,fishnet pantyhose,losing virginity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3651909145","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NDMyMTU2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTM1MDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NDMyMTU2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTM1MDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 70's London, a teenager is introduced to The Clash by his estranged mother and it changes his life forever."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001667/","name":"Jonathan Rhys Meyers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4948519/","name":"Daniel Huttlestone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779084/","name":"Dougray Scott"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0097517/","name":"Derrick Borte"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0296298/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030755/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0375102/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0114226/","name":"Matt Brown"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0839503/","name":"Sonya Gildea"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792202/","name":"Kirsten Sheridan"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

It changes his life forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1724597/","name":"London Town","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3NjU2MjYzOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTk4NzgwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In '70s London, a 14 year-old boy is introduced to the Clash by his estranged mother. It changes his life forever.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1724597/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"subxerogravity","dateCreated":"2016-10-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cool first hand story about a kid who gets introduced to The Clash (in more ways than one)","reviewBody":"I really liked Jonathan Rhys Meyers in it as Joe Strummer. It was fun to see him play a real lively character as the front man of The Clash.

The movie itself is more about how a boy named Shay is influenced by the music of the Clash while going through some hard times. His really hot mom (played by Natascha McElhone) left the family to live the life she wanted, while his father (Played by Dougray Scott), plays the classic stereotype of an adult who forgot what it was like to be young and is shifting too much responsibility on his son. 

London Town is greatly similar to another Coming-of-Age film, Sing Street (which is a little better), as Shay allows a crush on a punk rock girl to greatly influence his walk down the path of punk, which leads him to meeting Joe Strummer. 

The film's formula is very direct, and it's focus on punk rock makes it a perfect persona of the early days of the genre. It's a love letter to The Clash any fan would enjoy.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2285,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2016-10-07","keywords":"the clash,pantyhose,miniskirt,fishnet pantyhose,losing virginity","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3651909145","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NDMyMTU2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTM1MDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NDMyMTU2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTM1MDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 70's London, a teenager is introduced to The Clash by his estranged mother and it changes his life forever.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001667/","name":"Jonathan Rhys Meyers","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4948519/","name":"Daniel Huttlestone","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779084/","name":"Dougray Scott"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0097517/","name":"Derrick Borte"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0296298/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030755/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0375102/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0114226/","name":"Matt Brown","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0839503/","name":"Sonya Gildea","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792202/","name":"Kirsten Sheridan"],"duration":"PT1H32M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Confidence
Przekręt doskonały
Confidence
programme.desc:
Confidence: Directed by James Foley. With Edward Burns, Rachel Weisz, Morris Chestnut, Leland Orser. Jake Vig is a consummate grifter about to pull his biggest con yet, one set to avenge his friend's murder. But his last scam backfired, leaving him indebted to a mob boss and his enforcer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0310910/","name":"Confidence","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGQ2OTc5OTgtZmU1My00OWRlLWJkMGEtNjMxY2E1NGE3Y2Q3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTIxMzMzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jake Vig is a consummate grifter about to pull his biggest con yet, one set to avenge his friend's murder. But his last scam backfired, leaving him indebted to a mob boss and his enforcer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0310910/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Hey_Sweden"},"dateCreated":"2017-09-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Worth seeing for the cast.","reviewBody":""Confidence" is an ultra slick drama about con artists with a twist laden screenplay by Doug Jung. Edward Burns stars as experienced con man Jake Vig, who works with a small team. As the movie opens, they're scamming a loser accountant (Leland Orser) who just so happens to work for a crime kingpin, "The King" (Dustin Hoffman). Naturally, the kingpin wants revenge, but he and Vig work out a deal: Vig and his team will pull a scam on a financial high roller (Robert Forster) whom the kingpin resents.

For its duration, this is actually a rather involving story that holds ones' attention, although given the way that it plays out, and is ultimately resolved, it may have viewers thinking that the story wouldn't hold up to any intense scrutiny. There may indeed be a dearth of truly likable characters, but these people are still fascinating in spite of themselves. As in any film of this kind, it is amusing to see these seemingly intelligent schemers work their way through the steps of the con, and try to figure out how to solve problems. Director James Foley guides it all in style; with the help of his editor, Stuart Levy, he crafts a quickly moving scenario that has some mildly amusing surprises to dole out along the way.

It is a pleasure to watch this group of actors at work. Burns is a tight lipped anti-hero, Rachel Weisz is tantalizingly sexy as the new "shill" in his team, Andy Garcia is a hoot as a scruffy federal agent on Burns' tail, and Dustin Hoffman makes the most of his role as a creepy, somewhat irreverent crime figure. Morris Chestnut, Louis Lombardi, Paul Giamatti, Brian Van Holt, Donal Logue, Luis Guzman, Tommy 'Tiny' Lister, Franky G, John Carroll Lynch, and Robert Pine all deliver solid performances, with Giamatti in particular standing out. He offers some comedic content as a man who's fussy enough to not like using public restrooms.

Overall, entertaining stuff that doesn't set out to muck about with any formulas established in previous Hollywood features about con artists.

Seven out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33898,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2003-06-11","keywords":"con,grifter,organized crime,lap dance,shot in the forehead","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Confidence","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1270808857","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmE2NzM5YzQtOTQ2OC00Njk5LThhZTctNGE5OTFmM2FlNGE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmE2NzM5YzQtOTQ2OC00Njk5LThhZTctNGE5OTFmM2FlNGE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Lionsgate"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0122653/","name":"Edward Burns"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000163/","name":"Dustin Hoffman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001838/","name":"Rachel Weisz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001226/","name":"James Foley"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060306/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0018947/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037383/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1136647/","name":"Doug Jung"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Iron Lady
Żelazna Dama
The Iron Lady
programme.desc:
The Iron Lady: Directed by Phyllida Lloyd. With Meryl Streep, Jim Broadbent, Susan Brown, Alice da Cunha. An elderly Margaret Thatcher talks to the imagined presence of her recently deceased husband as she struggles to come to terms with his death while scenes from her past life, from girlhood to British prime minister, intervene." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1007029/","name":"The Iron Lady","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODEzNDUyMDE3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTgzOTg3Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An elderly Margaret Thatcher talks to the imagined presence of her recently deceased husband as she struggles to come to terms with his death while scenes from her past life, from girlhood to British prime minister, intervene.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1007029/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Loving_Silence"},"dateCreated":"2011-11-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Meryl Streep gives a spectacular performance in a flawed, but great biopic","reviewBody":"Before viewing, "The Iron Lady", I didn't really know much about Margaret Thatcher. Other than she was the prime minister of England for 11 years, she was a very controversial figure and still is to this day. So I was really interested to see the film and I decided to visit the WGA screening.

Now let me begin by saying, Meryl Streep embodies Margaret Thatcher. She doesn't just look like her, but she talks like her, her facial expressions are spot on. Meryl Streep becomes Margaret Thatcher. I would be shocked if she doesn't win an Oscar for this performance. The supporting cast is good too, Jim Broadbent gives an excellent performance, everyone is just great.

However aside from the top notch acting, the movie had a few flaws. The story was uninteresting at times, the flashback scenes were a bit muddled and a little confusing. The movie felt a little too safe, it tried too hard, not to be controversial. Although I don't entirely blame the film itself for that. Margaret Thatcher was such a decisive person, that whichever side the film picked, it would be criticized by a lot of people. I guess the film ultimately achieved the goal.

I also liked the movie didn't dwell too much on the politics, but on the character of Margaret Thatcher. We see the human side of The Iron Lady herself, beyond all the partisan politics and rumors, we get to see a very personal and sad side of her. The subplot focusing on Thacther's grief over her husband's death, as the older version battles with hallucinations and an unwillingness to let go of her dear Denis are heartbreaking.

Overall the movie was really well done, but just shy of greatness. Meryl Streep's performance and the supporting cast, truly elevates the film into a great biopic. Although I wished a little more time was spent on focusing on her political life, the movie successfully showed a deep and moving side of the prime minister. Which a lot of biopics fail to do. Whatever your opinions might be on Margaret Thatcher, don't fault the movie because of the opinion. And I highly respect Phyllida LLoyd, Meryl Streep, Abi Morgan and others for trying to portray such a decisive and highly controversial figure.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":106538,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-01-06","keywords":"old age,british conservative party,british female politician,british prime minister,prime minister","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1047305753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxMDYwNzc1M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTg3OTcyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxMDYwNzc1M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTg3OTcyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A look at the life of Margaret Thatcher, the former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, with a focus on the price she paid for power."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000658/","name":"Meryl Streep"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000980/","name":"Jim Broadbent"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001290/","name":"Richard E. Grant"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1630273/","name":"Phyllida Lloyd"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242217/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0197272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0604448/","name":"Abi Morgan"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

Other than she was the prime minister of England for 11 years, she was a very controversial figure and still is to this day. So I was really interested to see the film and I decided to visit the WGA screening.

Now let me begin by saying, Meryl Streep embodies Margaret Thatcher. She doesn't just look like her, but she talks like her, her facial expressions are spot on. Meryl Streep becomes Margaret Thatcher. I would be shocked if she doesn't win an Oscar for this performance. The supporting cast is good too, Jim Broadbent gives an excellent performance, everyone is just great.

However aside from the top notch acting, the movie had a few flaws. The story was uninteresting at times, the flashback scenes were a bit muddled and a little confusing. I also liked the movie didn't dwell too much on the politics, but on the character of Margaret Thatcher. We see the human side of The Iron Lady herself, beyond all the partisan politics and rumors, we get to see a very personal and sad side of her. The subplot focusing on Thacther's grief over her husband's death, as the older version battles with hallucinations and an unwillingness to let go of her dear Denis are heartbreaking.

Overall the movie was really well done, but just shy of greatness. Meryl Streep's performance and the supporting cast, truly elevates the film into a great biopic. Although I wished a little more time was spent on focusing on her political life, the movie successfully showed a deep and moving side of the prime minister. Which a lot of biopics fail to do. Whatever your opinions might be on Margaret Thatcher, don't fault the movie because of the opinion. programme.title: Little Women
Małe potworki
Little Monsters
programme.desc:
Little Women: Directed by Greta Gerwig. With Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson, Florence Pugh, Eliza Scanlen. Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3281548/","name":"Little Women","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2QzYTQyYzItMzAwYi00YjZlLThjNTUtNzMyMDdkYzJiNWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3281548/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"scenematica"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Love this little cute dear 4 women","reviewBody":"What we can expect from the girl as a movie director?

Meet Greta, a great director that will make you blame The Academy for not including her as Oscar Best Director nominees. For me, IMHO, she is more entitled to get Oscar Best Director nomination than Todd Philips.

How she direct the entire cast and crew, a camera movement, a music selection, everything is amazing.

programme.title: Na strajk!
programme.desc: Dzień z życia 19-letniego Karola, który opiekuje się dziadkiem chorym na alzheimera. Niebawem chłopak poznaje tajemnicę rodzinną związaną z dramatycznymi wydarzeniami podczas stoczniowych strajków w grudniu 1970 roku. Odkryta przeszłość zmusza go do podjęcia najważniejszej decyzji w życiu.

programme.title: We mnie
programme.desc: Sandra (Małgorzata Gorol) świętuje swój wieczór panieński. Zbliża się dzień ślubu, ale przedtem musi poddać się aborcji - płód ma wady genetyczne. Do szpitala jedzie z nią narzeczony. Z każdą kolejną minutą mężczyzna wydaje się Sandrze coraz bardziej obcy. Po zabiegu kobieta postanawia szczerze z nim porozmawiać.

programme.title: Szczescie swiata
Szczęście świata
programme.desc:
Szczescie swiata: Directed by Michal Rosa. With Karolina Gruszka, Mateusz Lickindorf, Grzegorz Palkowski, Dariusz Chojnacki. A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6104188/","name":"Szczescie swiata","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ3OTUzZWYtYTFlNi00Y2FhLWFmMDEtMGNkOGU2OTZlYWVjL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6104188/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Red-125"},"dateCreated":"2017-11-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent--but unusual--Polish film","reviewBody":"The Polish film Szczescie swiata (2016) was shown in the U.S. with the title The Happiness of the World. It was written and directed by Michal Rosa.

The movie is set in 1939 in an apartment house in Silesia--an area of Poland close to the German border. The apartment house itself is unusual. It's clearly not far from a city, but it sits in lonely isolation in a field. It's a very upscale place, and most of the people who live in it are middle or upper class. It's not what we in the U.S. would call a tenement, with poor people making ends meet. It's very elegant.

The plot centers around a journalist from a large city who is sent to the area to track down an elusive bestselling author. This search is more or less just a way to begin the story. When the reporter arrives, his first meeting is with the beautiful Róza, portrayed by Karolina Gruszka. 

Róza has many charms, which she openly displays to the reporter, as well as to any other man who joins her. In turn, director Rosa openly displays Gruszka's charms to his audience. We can all see why she's called "The Happiness of the World."

The movie plot is actually a series of vignettes. Each inhabitant of the apartment building has her or his own story. To a certain extent, the stories intersect, because all of the characters live in the same place. The pivotal figure in all of this is Róza. Karolina Gruszka isn't just another pretty face. She's an extraordinary actor, who is well known in Poland. The movie will rise or fall depending on Gruszka's presence on the screen. She's great, and the film rises accordingly.

We watched this movie in Rochester's excellent Little Theatre. It will work well on the small screen. The film was shown at the outstanding 2017 Rochester Polish Film Festival. After the film, director Rosa was in attendance for a Q&A session. (He doesn't speak English, but the interpreter who worked with him was superb.) My compliments to the PFF for bringing the director to Rochester.

For me, the most striking aspect of the Q&A was Mr. Rosa's discussion of magical realism. I believe that everyone in the audience noted magical realism in the movie. Director Rosa says that it isn't magical realism--it's just realism. I'm not sure if he was joking with us when he said that, or whether he actually believes that the type of events he shows us aren't magical at all. You'll have to watch the movie to see what you think about this realism.

P.S. The Happiness of the World has a dismal IMDb rating of 6.3. It's a much, much better movie than that. Again, you'll have to watch the movie and then decide for yourself.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":126,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-12-23","keywords":"silesia,bathtub,femme fatale","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344734/","name":"Karolina Gruszka"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8475166/","name":"Mateusz Lickindorf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2707614/","name":"Grzegorz Palkowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330220/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0577510/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Raoul Taburin
Tajemnica Raoula Taburina
Raoul Taburin
programme.desc: Raoul Taburin: Directed by Pierre Godeau. With Benoît Poelvoorde, Edouard Baer, Suzanne Clément, Victor Assié. Raoul Taburin is the story of a little boy who has grown up without knowing how to ride a bike. The story of an immense misunderstanding lived as a curse. programme.title: Hi, how are You
programme.desc: Od niemal dziesięciu lat Nathan wiedzie udane życie u boku żony. Pewnego dnia odwiedza go Bob. Przynosi wiadomość dotyczącą wydarzeń z przeszłości, która bezpowrotnie burzy jego spokój.

programme.title: Les ailes de la colombe
Skrzydła gołębicy
Les ailes de la colombe
programme.desc: Les ailes de la colombe: Directed by Benoît Jacquot. With Isabelle Huppert, Dominique Sanda, Michele Placido, Loleh Bellon. A mature lady approaches a young actor and offers him a great amount of money to get acquainted with her lonely daughter, who suffers of an incurable illness. Eventually a true romance emerges, as mother has secret feelings for the man, while he truly falls in love with the daughter. After the expected death of the daughter, the man leaves in grief rejecting the money, and the mature woman stays in deep loneliness, trying to cope with a double loss." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0155479/","name":"Les ailes de la colombe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDVjMTYzYTYtNmJlOS00NmNjLTg1YWEtOWUyZTUyOTM2YTRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzU0NzkwMDg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mature lady approaches a young actor and offers him a great amount of money to get acquainted with her lonely daughter, who suffers of an incurable illness. programme.title: Euforia
Euphoria
programme.desc: Siostry Emilie (Eva Green) i Ines (Alicia Vikander) nie rozmawiają ze sobą od lat. Obie jednak mają nadzieję, że kiedyś uda im się naprawić wzajemne relacje. Wyjeżdżają w podróż, która daje szansę na upragnione pojednanie. Trafiają do pewnej osobliwej osady...

programme.title: To, co zostaje
programme.desc: Marianna (Marta Ścisłowicz) i Jan (Piotr Czarniecki) wiodą szczęśliwe życie na wsi w północno-wschodniej Polsce. Pewnego dnia kobieta musi stawić czoła niespodziewanej śmierci męża. Wyrzuty sumienia i nagła strata sprawiają, że potrzebuje czasu, żeby pożegnać ukochanego. Zamyka się z jego ciałem w domu. Jej zachowanie spotyka się z niezrozumieniem mieszkańców wioski.

credits.actor: Marta Ścisłowicz
Piotr Czarniecki
Michał Jaros
Elżbieta Studniarek
Natan Kryczyński

programme.title: Memory: The Origins of Alien
Wspomnienia: Geneza „Obcego”
Memory: The Origins of Alien
programme.desc: Memory: The Origins of Alien: Directed by Alexandre O. Philippe. With Bijan Aalam, Tim Boxell, Axelle Carolyn, Veronica Cartwright. An in-depth voyage into the sci-fi film "Alien" with the visionary filmmakers who created it. See how one of the most terrifying movies of all time came to life 40 years ago, inspired by ancient mythology and our universal fears." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8974964/","name":"Memory: The Origins of Alien","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzZjZWZhOWUtMGFkMS00NGRhLThmN2EtNmZlMTRkOWRlMzQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDExMzMxNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An in-depth voyage into the sci-fi film "Alien" with the visionary filmmakers who created it. See how one of the most terrifying movies of all time came to life 40 years ago, inspired by ancient mythology and our universal fears.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8974964/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Huud"},"dateCreated":"2019-09-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"What a missed Opportunity","reviewBody":"Well, the only GOOD news is, hopefully one day someone will take the helm and do a truly comprehensive documentary about "Alien". This is NOT it. "Alien" certainly deserves it. While this documentary may include some existential and interesting contributions not before stated it certainly lacks in giving credit where credit is due. Alien is an artistic endeavor and unfortunately leaves out a whole lot of artists involved. Where was Ron Cobb (set design) and Mobius (costume, and ship design). Oh, no. Those were all RIDLEY's ideas (according to the documentary). And what about POST PRODUCTION? Ben Burtt is mentioned ONCE and NO mention at all about music and this is what really amazed me, NO MENTION about editorial. If you are a true "Alien" fan then you will have heard MOST of what is in this already. Give it a pass and hope for somebody later to pick up and carry the torch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2564,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Documentary","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2019-10-04","keywords":"francis bacon,reenactment,facehugger,film history,film making","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3283468057","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODlhMzA2NGMtYWUyNC00YjE5LWIwZWEtMzQ2ODkyN2M5ZWMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODlhMzA2NGMtYWUyNC00YjE5LWIwZWEtMzQ2ODkyN2M5ZWMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"The untold origin story behind Ridley Scott's 'Alien' - rooted in Greek and Egyptian mythologies, underground comics, the art of Francis Bacon, and the dark visions of Dan O'Bannon and H.R. Giger. A contemplation on the symbiotic collaborative process of movie-making, the power of myth, and our collective unconscious."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3865525/","name":"Bijan Aalam"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0101521/","name":"Tim Boxell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2130745/","name":"Axelle Carolyn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1465431/","name":"Alexandre O. programme.title: The New Daughter
Córka
The New Daughter
programme.desc:
The New Daughter: Directed by Luiso Berdejo. With Kevin Costner, Ivana Baquero, Samantha Mathis, Gattlin Griffith. A single father moves his two children to rural South Carolina, only to watch his daughter exhibit increasingly strange behavior." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0951335/","name":"The New Daughter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNTQ2MzM4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTgzNDcyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A single father moves his two children to rural South Carolina, only to watch his daughter exhibit increasingly strange behavior.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0951335/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Samiam3"},"dateCreated":"2010-05-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Spooky story done badly","reviewBody":"Up to a certain point in The New Daughter, I was reminded of Dragonfly. Both are low budget Costner films about a man dealing with a family loss which has a haunting outcome. It has been a while since I saw Dragonfly. Nobody thought it was any good, but it is way better than this film. To start with the obvious, The New Daughter represents what may be Costner's most lazy performance. It seems he has no interest in the story whatsoever. After a while the Dragonfly connection starts to fade away, and the movie turns into something else, something worse unfortunately. The New Daughter is torpid, and is bogged down by too much content, and not enough suspense or intelligent dialogue.

If I am gonna give the film any credit, it would be for photography. This is a gorgeously shot film, where the nights are cold, eerie and evocative, and the safety of home is warm, glowing and golden. The best shot in the film is the last one, which barely makes up for the utter stupidity of the ending. There is much left to explain, but in the end, I don't really care.

IMDb data; ttnr: 0951335, Title: The New Daughter, --- Description: The New Daughter: Directed by Luiso Berdejo. With Kevin Costner, Ivana Baquero, Samantha Mathis, Gattlin Griffith. A single father moves his two children to rural South Carolina, only to watch his daughter exhibit increasingly strange behavior." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0951335/","name":"The New Daughter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNTQ2MzM4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTgzNDcyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A single father moves his two children to rural South Carolina, only to watch his daughter exhibit increasingly strange behavior.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0951335/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Samiam3","dateCreated":"2010-05-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Spooky story done badly","reviewBody":"Up to a certain point in The New Daughter, I was reminded of Dragonfly. Both are low budget Costner films about a man dealing with a family loss which has a haunting outcome. It has been a while since I saw Dragonfly. Nobody thought it was any good, but it is way better than this film. To start with the obvious, The New Daughter represents what may be Costner's most lazy performance. It seems he has no interest in the story whatsoever. After a while the Dragonfly connection starts to fade away, and the movie turns into something else, something worse unfortunately. The New Daughter is torpid, and is bogged down by too much content, and not enough suspense or intelligent dialogue.

If I am gonna give the film any credit, it would be for photography. This is a gorgeously shot film, where the nights are cold, eerie and evocative, and the safety of home is warm, glowing and golden. The best shot in the film is the last one, which barely makes up for the utter stupidity of the ending. There is much left to explain, but in the end, I don't really care.

The New Daughter, is a spooky story, which is occasionally interesting but is less so than it is sloppily executed, badly acted, and not worth your money.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14887,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2010-10-07","keywords":"mound,ant farm,indian burial ground,shotgun,father daughter relationship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The New Daughter","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2034828313","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0MDM1ODA0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODQwNDczMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0MDM1ODA0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODQwNDczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A single father moves his two children to rural South Carolina, only to watch his daughter exhibit increasingly strange behavior. programme.title: The Children Act
The Lodgers. Przeklęci
The Lodgers
programme.desc: The Children Act: Directed by Richard Eyre. With Emma Thompson, Stanley Tucci, Jason Watkins, Fionn Whitehead. As her marriage crumbles, a judge must decide a case involving a teenage boy who is refusing a blood transfusion on religious principle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6040662/","name":"The Children Act","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODUwOTk1MzI3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTI4NDE3NTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"As her marriage crumbles, a judge must decide a case involving a teenage boy who is refusing a blood transfusion on religious principle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6040662/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Kumarh02"},"dateCreated":"2018-09-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not a 'must watch' tower","reviewBody":"The trailer really wets the appetite and if like me, you were expecting a lengthy legal battle with a dose of moral dilemma and lashings of emotion, you will be disappointed. The JW blood element is short and fleeting as the film concentrated more on the marriage problems between ET & ST, who perform fantastically as ever btw, and the wild infatuations of a confused boy. There was some misrepresentation of JW's, the Kingdom Hall didn't look like any I had ever set foot in, it painted a biased picture of people's interpretation of faith and there language and terminology felt archaic and old testamenty. There are few a divisive topics as refusing blood transfusions for minors based on religious faith and this particular showing didn't leave me or my party much to deliberate on after the credits. Overall, a missed opportunity and a waste of a fine cast.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12338,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-08-24","keywords":"female judge,husband wife relationship,teenage boy,teenager,17 year old","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2677390105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIzYmNjOGItNWY1ZC00ZmI5LWFhMGMtZTI0OGMwYTczNmE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGIzYmNjOGItNWY1ZC00ZmI5LWFhMGMtZTI0OGMwYTczNmE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"As her marriage to Jack (Stanley Tucci) flounders, eminent High Court judge Fiona Maye (Emma Thompson) has a life-changing decision to make at work - should she force a teenage boy, Adam (Fionn Whitehead), to have the blood transfusion that will save his life? Her unorthodox visit to his hospital bedside has a profound impact on them both, stirring strong new emotions in the boy and long-buried feelings in her."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001804/","name":"Stanley Tucci"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0914327/","name":"Jason Watkins"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0264236/","name":"Richard Eyre"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0209419/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251858/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0568605/","name":"Ian McEwan"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cały ten horror
programme.desc: Dziennikarz Tal Zimerman, znawca horroru w powieści, kinie i innych elementach kultury, zgłębia zagadnienia związane z tym tematem. W rozmowach z reżyserami, aktorami, a także pisarzami dąży do ustalenia, dlaczego ludzie lubią uczucie strachu, czy oglądanie przerażających fabuł potęguje lęki, czy może ma działanie terapeutyczne.

programme.title: Winchester
Dom, który zbudował Jack
The House That Jack Built
programme.desc: Winchester: Directed by Michael Spierig, Peter Spierig. With Helen Mirren, Sarah Snook, Finn Scicluna-O'Prey, Jason Clarke. Ensconced in her sprawling San Jose, California mansion, eccentric firearm heiress Sarah Winchester (Dame Helen Mirren) believes she is haunted by the souls of people killed by the Winchester repeating rifle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1072748/","name":"Winchester","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2OWE5OGItMTE4Yi00ZmIzLThjZDctNTU1OTMxMTc3Yjg4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4NTM5NDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ensconced in her sprawling San Jose, California mansion, eccentric firearm heiress Sarah Winchester (Dame Helen Mirren) believes she is haunted by the souls of people killed by the Winchester repeating rifle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1072748/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ryslocum"},"dateCreated":"2018-02-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not a mindless horror movie, but still not a smart one.","reviewBody":"It is better than most "Paranormal Activity" sequels in regards that the make-up effects are very well done. The biggest flaw with the movie is the dialogue. The dialogue, for a lack of a better word, is just plain corny. I struggle to enjoy a movie with horrible dialogue, but if you can get past that flaw you should enjoy this movie very much.\n\nThere are multiple jumpscares throughout the movie which did cause audience member to jump and gasp. The scenery of the movie is my favorite part, as the scenery is what made me feel uneasy with fear. The lighting of the scenes are perfect and the re-creation of the supposedly horrifying house are gripping. If you are easily scared you should have a blast with this movie! For horror fans that are looking for some exceptional horror, this movie is not for you.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":32595,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","Horror"],"datePublished":"2018-02-02","keywords":"ghost,winchester house,widower,gothic horror,haunted house","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Tease","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2287974681","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5MDA2NjE3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjEyMDEwNDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5MDA2NjE3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjEyMDEwNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"On an isolated stretch of land 50 miles outside of San Francisco sits the most haunted house in the world. Built by Sarah Winchester, heiress to the Winchester fortune, it is a house that knows no end. Constructed in an incessant twenty-four hour a day, seven day a week mania for decades, it stands seven stories tall and contains hundreds of rooms. To the outsider it looks like a monstrous monument to a disturbed woman's madness. But Sarah is not building for herself, for her niece or for the brilliant Doctor Eric Price whom she has summoned to the house. She is building a prison, an asylum for hundreds of vengeful ghosts, and the most terrifying among them have a score to settle with the Winchesters..."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000545/","name":"Helen Mirren"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3512758/","name":"Sarah Snook"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7073477/","name":"Finn Scicluna-O'Prey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294961/","name":"Michael Spierig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294962/","name":"Peter Spierig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047306/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0380601/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0215453/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1129343/","name":"Tom Vaughan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294961/","name":"Michael Spierig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294962/","name":"Peter Spierig"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Born Bad
Przegrani
Born Bad
programme.desc: Born Bad: Directed by Jeff Yonis. With James Remar, Corey Feldman, Justin Walker, Ryan Francis. A group of teenagers rob a bank, causing a deadly standoff." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0118752/","name":"Born Bad","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA2NDQ4NjQ4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODAzNzUxMjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of teenagers rob a bank, causing a deadly standoff.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118752/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pjwhite286"},"dateCreated":"2007-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Born Bad is AWESOME!","reviewBody":"This movie about a group of small town teens that decide to rob the local bank is excellent. Brian (Justin Walker) wants to get out of his small town, much like Jimmy Stewart in "It's A Wonderful Life." However, unlike George Bailey, Brian is going to rob a bank to finance his dream of attending art school, even if his father is not supportive. The offer to Brian is to act like a customer and distract the guard. It's a tempting offer that if offered to many, I question what they would do. Anyways, Brian does it. When the Sheriff (James Remar) and his force surround the bank, things go from bad to worse. It's a standoff with even the Feds moving in to kill the kids if they have a clean shot. The Sheriff must prevent this and try to end the standoff in a peaceful way. Unfortunately, tensions rise, and the teens inside turn on each other. Some are out of control. The paper cutter scene is gruesome and hard to watch. A group of teenagers rob a bank, causing a deadly standoff." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0118752/","name":"Born Bad","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA2NDQ4NjQ4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODAzNzUxMjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of teenagers rob a bank, causing a deadly standoff.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118752/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"pjwhite286","dateCreated":"2007-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Born Bad is AWESOME!","reviewBody":"This movie about a group of small town teens that decide to rob the local bank is excellent. Brian (Justin Walker) wants to get out of his small town, much like Jimmy Stewart in "It's A Wonderful Life." However, unlike George Bailey, Brian is going to rob a bank to finance his dream of attending art school, even if his father is not supportive. The offer to Brian is to act like a customer and distract the guard. It's a tempting offer that if offered to many, I question what they would do. Anyways, Brian does it. When the Sheriff (James Remar) and his force surround the bank, things go from bad to worse. It's a standoff with even the Feds moving in to kill the kids if they have a clean shot. The Sheriff must prevent this and try to end the standoff in a peaceful way. Unfortunately, tensions rise, and the teens inside turn on each other. Some are out of control. The paper cutter scene is gruesome and hard to watch. A famous L.A. hitman falls in love with his target." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1266149/","name":"Twin Daggers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjk0MDU4NDE2M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzE3MjA2MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A famous L.A. hitman falls in love with his target.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1266149/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"verseczy"},"dateCreated":"2008-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Perhaps Richard Roeper's Kind Of Martial Arts Movie","reviewBody":"Warning all martial arts movie fans: Don't watch this! I wish there was a review or a clue to prevent me from renting this atrocity. I promised myself, I will not rate any movie with 1 out of 10, simply because somebody put time and effort into realization of such, and that alone deserves rating 2.

However how can you justify so much standing, sitting, dancing around in any movie let alone in martial arts or self proclaimed action film. Add to that: horrific acting, stupid script, terrible sound, fight scenes so hilarious for a good while I thought I'm watching a spoof, and editing at accelerated speed to cover up protagonists clumsiness in fighting skills. If they were to use any famous doubles you wouldn't had have hard time to recognize them at all.

I can only recommend this movie to Richard Roeper on the fact that he gave Ong Bak a thumb down in Ebert & Roeper at the Movies with reasoning that there was only 7 minutes of plot in excess to action. Well, Happy Birthday Richard, here is THE movie for you: Twin Daggers! All you can consume buffet of fable, followed by lengthy abeyance, to finish off with just a dash of engagement.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":296,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action"],"datePublished":"2008-07-22","keywords":"hitman,violence,martial arts","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065316/","name":"Rhett Giles"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3080460/","name":"Coco Su"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157242/","name":"Veronica Bero"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155292/","name":"Kun-Hou Chen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078389/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065443/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0139852/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11888805/","name":"Allen Shan"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hollywood Homicide
Wydział zabójstw, Hollywood
Hollywood Homicide
programme.desc:
Hollywood Homicide: Directed by Ron Shelton. With Harrison Ford, Josh Hartnett, Lena Olin, Bruce Greenwood. Two LAPD detectives who moonlight in other fields investigate the murder of an up-and-coming rap group." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0329717/","name":"Hollywood Homicide","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5Mjk1NzQ4Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMTYxNzk5._V1_.jpg","description":"Two LAPD detectives who moonlight in other fields investigate the murder of an up-and-coming rap group.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0329717/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jpschapira"},"dateCreated":"2005-06-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"More unusual than expected","reviewBody":"Taking another chance on L.A, on the streets and more specifically on the police, as in "Dark Blue", Ron Shelton, a man of multiple themes, brings a new project to the table, which is called "Hollywood Homicide". The difference between this one and the latter one is that this is Hollywood, precisely. And when the beginning credits roll, and we're shown fifty "Hollywood" signs; it's obvious that they want us to realize that. Why would it be? 

The story about Ron Shelton meeting Robert Souza in the set of "Dark Blue" and them both getting together to write the script of "Hollywood Homicide", because Souza had been a cop before Interesting. However, in the same vein, "Dark Blue" is the portrait of a cruel reality; "Hollywood Homicide" is the satire of a shallow but real reality in the end. It's Hollywood, and it was a good premise to put some fun in the crime scenes, probably to make it "more dramatic than anything seen in Hollywood".

The other elements the plot offers go from action to crime, or vice versa. They created the murderer of a rap band, so they could mess a little bit with the music business, too. There we see the producers, the groups, the "showbiz" It's even related with theater and movies, because one of the main characters wants to be an actor; and in a decent comedic way, he's thinking about acting each time he's doing something; and he probably isn't that good.

I'm talking about K.C Calden; Josh Hartnett's character. He gives classes of movements to find the inner self. There, a lot of hot women assist and kiss him when they leave. In one scene, his partner tells him that he did for sex. "At first it was for sex, now it has become something spiritual", K.C answers, and at night, a hot woman is waiting for him in the "Jacuzzi". "How long has it been since the last time you got laid", K.C asks his partner. "It's not your business", the partner says. Then, he lets a man working as a prostitute into his car. When they discuss that, he says: "It was nothing, it was a man, a cop; a cop man".

This partner is Joe Gavilan, a pro in the police business played by a pro in the acting business. As he did with Kurt Russell in "Dark Blue", Shelton brings Harrison Ford back to the top of his game. With his character, based on writer Robert Souzas's own life, he has the best lines and he has a lot of fun. Antoine Sartain (Isaiah Washington) should be afraid of him; a man that has had sex, with Ruby (an over the top Lena Olin) and makes real estate business with producer Jerry Duran (the great Martin Landau) and Julius Armas (a correct Master P) while he's driving a car high speed. When he is told the composer of the rap group is still alive, he replies: "Somebody actually writes that s***?". He has had bad times, Bennie Macko (Bruce Greenwood) wants to get him, and in the best scene of the movie, he and K.C get interrogated. This scene is managed with camera changes between the two interrogating rooms, where in Joe's, his cell is always ringing; and in K.C's, he is "centering" himself spiritually. Joe's interrogator can't do anything, while K.C's interrogator (a woman) asks him to help her relax.

That scene stole the only laughs from me during the entire film. Keith David was also having fun in his Leo role, reprising some of the comic elements he gave to Lester Wallace in "Barbershop". More importantly, and if you were wondering, Shelton directs his actors perfectly, making a stupendous balance between the pro and the amateur, the old and the young; Harrison Ford and Josh Hartnett. Their chemistry is perfect, and one of the few reasons to watch the movie. In the end, their characters are nothing else but cops, in a film that leaves a lot of plot situations unresolved, is a bit long, not funny enough, but different from the gross humor that everyone finds easy to put on paper.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36772,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2003-10-08","keywords":"criminal investigation,murder investigation,usa,united states,murder","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hollywood Homicide","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2091712793","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU4NWNlZGEtMzQ3Yi00MzNiLTkxNTEtMDVhNTI4YTMwYzYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU4NWNlZGEtMzQ3Yi00MzNiLTkxNTEtMDVhNTI4YTMwYzYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000148/","name":"Harrison Ford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001326/","name":"Josh Hartnett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0913460/","name":"Isaiah Washington"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005421/","name":"Ron Shelton"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0177995/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0034610/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1226736/","name":"Robert Souza"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005421/","name":"Ron Shelton"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0329717, Title: Hollywood Homicide, --- Description: Hollywood Homicide: Directed by Ron Shelton. With Harrison Ford, Josh Hartnett, Lena Olin, Bruce Greenwood. Two LAPD detectives who moonlight in other fields investigate the murder of an up-and-coming rap group." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0329717/","name":"Hollywood Homicide","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5Mjk1NzQ4Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMTYxNzk5._V1_.jpg","description":"Two LAPD detectives who moonlight in other fields investigate the murder of an up-and-coming rap group.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0329717/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jpschapira","dateCreated":"2005-06-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"More unusual than expected","reviewBody":"Taking another chance on L.A, on the streets and more specifically on the police, as in "Dark Blue", Ron Shelton, a man of multiple themes, brings a new project to the table, which is called "Hollywood Homicide". The difference between this one and the latter one is that this is Hollywood, precisely. And when the beginning credits roll, and we're shown fifty "Hollywood" signs; it's obvious that they want us to realize that. Why would it be? 

The story about Ron Shelton meeting Robert Souza in the set of "Dark Blue" and them both getting together to write the script of "Hollywood Homicide", because Souza had been a cop before Interesting. However, in the same vein, "Dark Blue" is the portrait of a cruel reality; "Hollywood Homicide" is the satire of a shallow but real reality in the end. It's Hollywood, and it was a good premise to put some fun in the crime scenes, probably to make it "more dramatic than anything seen in Hollywood".

The other elements the plot offers go from action to crime, or vice versa. They created the murderer of a rap band, so they could mess a little bit with the music business, too. There we see the producers, the groups, the "showbiz" It's even related with theater and movies, because one of the main characters wants to be an actor; and in a decent comedic way, he's thinking about acting each time he's doing something; and he probably isn't that good.

I'm talking about K.C Calden; Josh Hartnett's character. He gives classes of movements to find the inner self. There, a lot of hot women assist and kiss him when they leave. In one scene, his partner tells him that he did for sex. "At first it was for sex, now it has become something spiritual", K.C answers, and at night, a hot woman is waiting for him in the "Jacuzzi". "How long has it been since the last time you got laid", K.C asks his partner. "It's not your business", the partner says. Then, he lets a man working as a prostitute into his car. When they discuss that, he says: "It was nothing, it was a man, a cop; a cop man".

This partner is Joe Gavilan, a pro in the police business played by a pro in the acting business. As he did with Kurt Russell in "Dark Blue", Shelton brings Harrison Ford back to the top of his game. With his character, based on writer Robert Souzas's own life, he has the best lines and he has a lot of fun. Antoine Sartain (Isaiah Washington) should be afraid of him; a man that has had sex, with Ruby (an over the top Lena Olin) and makes real estate business with producer Jerry Duran (the great Martin Landau) and Julius Armas (a correct Master P) while he's driving a car high speed. When he is told the composer of the rap group is still alive, he replies: "Somebody actually writes that s***?". He has had bad times, Bennie Macko (Bruce Greenwood) wants to get him, and in the best scene of the movie, he and K.C get interrogated. This scene is managed with camera changes between the two interrogating rooms, where in Joe's, his cell is always ringing; and in K.C's, he is "centering" himself spiritually. Joe's interrogator can't do anything, while K.C's interrogator (a woman) asks him to help her relax.

That scene stole the only laughs from me during the entire film. Keith David was also having fun in his Leo role, reprising some of the comic elements he gave to Lester Wallace in "Barbershop". More importantly, and if you were wondering, Shelton directs his actors perfectly, making a stupendous balance between the pro and the amateur, the old and the young; Harrison Ford and Josh Hartnett. Their chemistry is perfect, and one of the few reasons to watch the movie. In the end, their characters are nothing else but cops, in a film that leaves a lot of plot situations unresolved, is a bit long, not funny enough, but different from the gross humor that everyone finds easy to put on paper.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36772,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2003-10-08","keywords":"criminal investigation,murder investigation,usa,united states,murder","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hollywood Homicide","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2091712793","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU4NWNlZGEtMzQ3Yi00MzNiLTkxNTEtMDVhNTI4YTMwYzYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU4NWNlZGEtMzQ3Yi00MzNiLTkxNTEtMDVhNTI4YTMwYzYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000148/","name":"Harrison Ford","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001326/","name":"Josh Hartnett","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0913460/","name":"Isaiah Washington"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005421/","name":"Ron Shelton"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0177995/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0034610/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1226736/","name":"Robert Souza","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005421/","name":"Ron Shelton"],"duration":"PT1H56M"</script><metacontent="
