programme.title: Anaconda: Offspring
Anakonda 3: Potomstwo
Anaconda III
programme.desc:
Anaconda: Offspring: Directed by Don E. FauntLeRoy. With David Hasselhoff, Crystal Allen, Ryan McCluskey, Patrick Regis. A mercenary-for-hire accepts a mission from a billionaire to capture a dangerous snake that could possibly help cure a terminal illness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1137996/","name":"Anaconda: Offspring","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGY5MDI5Y2ItNDk2MS00NzJlLWJmMTEtNGYwM2Y4ZjU2MjIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mercenary-for-hire accepts a mission from a billionaire to capture a dangerous snake that could possibly help cure a terminal illness.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1137996/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"player_pawn"},"dateCreated":"2008-09-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Where's the Hoff?","reviewBody":"When a film features David Hasselhoff and his crack team of snake-fighting mercenaries facing off against a 60-foot-long genetically altered anaconda before the opening credits even roll, any fan of B-movie cheese can arguably presume they're in for a good time. Hasselhoff's self-deprecating humor and strange otherworldly charm make him an endearing punchline, and also translates well into the world of Sci Fi Channel stardom. Sadly, after that opening scene, The Hoff all but disappears for the next 45 minutes of the film, and what starts with campy reptile-killin' fun quickly spirals into boring laboratory diatribes about the dangers of gene manipulation and the real-world uses of unlikely immortality drugs.

Although the ads would lead one to believe otherwise, ANACONDA III actually centers on Amanda (Crystal Allen), a scientist who works for Universal Bio-Tech and the nefariousand appropriately namedMurdoch (John Rhys-Davies, obviously still fuming over not being included in the new Indiana Jones film). It seems that he's been playing God with the reptilian world and has somehow managed to create an anaconda that's not only larger and angrier than any snake on Earth, but sports a three-foot machete growing out of its tail. This Ginsu butt comes into play numerous times during the film, and while the results are always spectacularly gory, a serpent's bladed posterior is inescapably difficult to take seriously.

Since all B-movie snakes carry the cure for (insert disease here), another round of unethical testing is underway, and it isn't long before our slithering behemoth breaks out of its cage, knocks off everyone but Amanda and her boss and heads out into the lush green wilderness of Romania. It's only then that Hasselhoff's Hammett and a group of ALIENS space-Marine rejects (resembling the United Colors of Benetton) are hired to eradicate the monster, which has taken up residence in a nearby farmhouse. With that, we've now got the prerequisite team of Special Ops, the cheap sets and the giant CG monster everything required for a yet another weak entry in the recent string of bland Sci Fi Channel originals.

Director Don E. FauntLeroy, who served as DP on the JEEPERS CREEPERS movies and nearly 50 other films, has managed to shoot a good-looking feature, but fills it with every painful cliché imaginable. First-time screenwriters Nicholas Davidoff and David Olson sprinkle in occasionally fun dialogue, but their script is ultimately burdened down with bland characters and extremely corny, uninspired plot twists. Hasselhoff's Hammett, a fun antihero who deserves more screen time (and one-liners), is delegated to a glorified supporting role beneath far less interesting characters. Rhys-Davies, whose cameo appearances work quite well, will hopefully receive a beefier role in ANACONDA IV (the direct sequel shot back to back with this movie, scheduled to debut this December); otherwise, he served virtually no purpose at all. It's only Allen as the spunky Amanda who breathes any life into her role; a surprise, given her lack of substantial film experience prior to headlining this one. Unfortunately, given the material, even she has trouble rising above the movie's stupendous mediocrity. When all is said and done, ANACONDA III should have been a much better film, but it also could have been much worse. The cast is sorely mismanaged, the plot is all over the board and the digital FXparticularly a handful of atrocious greenscreen driving shotsare by-and-large laughable, but the cast and crew obviously worked hard with what little they had. With any luck, this sequel's surviving characters will find more to do in the next entry, and we'll end up with a film that's not just meatier, but more entertaining. A direct-to-cable second follow-up to a creature feature headlined by J. Lo and Ice Cube doesn't need to be a masterpiece, but it should be passable as an evening's fleeting distraction. ANACONDA III is just barely that, but it's still regrettable that something as inherently amusing as David Hasselhoff fighting a giant snake couldn't have ended up just the slightest bit more fun.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7680,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Horror"],"datePublished":"2008-07-26","keywords":"anaconda,snakeskin,psychotronic film,woman wears a gas mask,snake","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Anaconda III: Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2085683225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1MDk2NDQ2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzI0OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1MDk2NDQ2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzI0OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mercenary-for-hire accepts a mission from a billionaire to capture a dangerous snake that could possibly help cure a terminal illness."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001327/","name":"David Hasselhoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1296597/","name":"Crystal Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011675/","name":"Ryan McCluskey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005703/","name":"Don E. FauntLeRoy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020879/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0186146/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1682328/","name":"Nicholas Davidoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2837937/","name":"David C. Olson"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Fog

The Fog
programme.desc: The Fog: Directed by John Carpenter. With Adrienne Barbeau, Jamie Lee Curtis, Janet Leigh, John Houseman. An unearthly fog rolls into a small coastal town exactly 100 years after a ship mysteriously sank in its waters." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0080749/","name":"The Fog","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmMwMWM1MWMtOGJlYS00NmIyLWI0MjYtNjJkNDI5OWQ2YjE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unearthly fog rolls into a small coastal town exactly 100 years after a ship mysteriously sank in its waters.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0080749/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BaronBl00d"},"dateCreated":"1999-11-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Creepy Atmosphere","reviewBody":"John Houseman sits around a campfire telling children about the story of a ship that went down near their home Antonio Bay and how the drowned sailors will reappear 100 years to that very night in the fog. It is a wonderful beginning to a very chilling film, directed by the modern horror meister John Carpenter. As with most of his films, Carpenter creates a scary atmosphere through moody settings(the California coastline, a lighthouse, an old Church), relentless mood music as in Halloween, good character acting(Holbrook, Houseman, Curtis, Leigh), and a claustrophobic feeling of something vice-like gripping you. The story has some plot problems, but none enough to detract from the overall enjoyment of the film. Adrienne Barbeau is as lovely as ever in the lead, and the film is credible amidst the background of supernatural actions."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":69528,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1980-02-08","keywords":"fog,ghost ship,lighthouse,navigator,sea","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer (4K Restoration)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1545648921","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjdjNWY3YzctYTQ5Yy00MmM3LTgzM2ItZWZiNmY2ZjQ1MDMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjdjNWY3YzctYTQ5Yy00MmM3LTgzM2ItZWZiNmY2ZjQ1MDMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unearthly fog rolls into a small coastal town exactly 100 years after a ship mysteriously sank in its waters."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000105/","name":"Adrienne Barbeau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000130/","name":"Jamie Lee Curtis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001463/","name":"Janet Leigh"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000118/","name":"John Carpenter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066770/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050464/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073430/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000118/","name":"John Carpenter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0384185/","name":"Debra Hill"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0080749, Title: The Fog, --- Description: The Fog: Directed by John Carpenter. With Adrienne Barbeau, Jamie Lee Curtis, Janet Leigh, John Houseman. An unearthly fog rolls into a small coastal town exactly 100 years after a ship mysteriously sank in its waters." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0080749/","name":"The Fog","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmMwMWM1MWMtOGJlYS00NmIyLWI0MjYtNjJkNDI5OWQ2YjE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unearthly fog rolls into a small coastal town exactly 100 years after a ship mysteriously sank in its waters.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0080749/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"BaronBl00d","dateCreated":"1999-11-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Creepy Atmosphere","reviewBody":"John Houseman sits around a campfire telling children about the story of a ship that went down near their home Antonio Bay and how the drowned sailors will reappear 100 years to that very night in the fog. It is a wonderful beginning to a very chilling film, directed by the modern horror meister John Carpenter. As with most of his films, Carpenter creates a scary atmosphere through moody settings(the California coastline, a lighthouse, an old Church), relentless mood music as in Halloween, good character acting(Holbrook, Houseman, Curtis, Leigh), and a claustrophobic feeling of something vice-like gripping you. The story has some plot problems, but none enough to detract from the overall enjoyment of the film. Adrienne Barbeau is as lovely as ever in the lead, and the film is credible amidst the background of supernatural actions.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":69528,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1980-02-08","keywords":"fog,ghost ship,lighthouse,navigator,sea","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer (4K Restoration)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1545648921","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjdjNWY3YzctYTQ5Yy00MmM3LTgzM2ItZWZiNmY2ZjQ1MDMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjdjNWY3YzctYTQ5Yy00MmM3LTgzM2ItZWZiNmY2ZjQ1MDMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unearthly fog rolls into a small coastal town exactly 100 years after a ship mysteriously sank in its waters.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000105/","name":"Adrienne Barbeau","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000130/","name":"Jamie Lee Curtis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001463/","name":"Janet Leigh"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000118/","name":"John Carpenter"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066770/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050464/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073430/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000118/","name":"John Carpenter","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0384185/","name":"Debra Hill"],"duration":"PT1H29M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fighting
Fighting
programme.desc: Fighting: Directed by Dito Montiel. With Channing Tatum, Terrence Howard, Zulay Henao, Michael Rivera. In New York City, a young counterfeiter is introduced to the world of underground street fighting by a seasoned scam artist, who becomes his manager on the bare-knuckling brawling circuit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1082601/","name":"Fighting","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk5NjM3MjA5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODI2MTQ0Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In New York City, a young counterfeiter is introduced to the world of underground street fighting by a seasoned scam artist, who becomes his manager on the bare-knuckling brawling circuit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1082601/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Red_Identity"},"dateCreated":"2010-08-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dull and flat out bad","reviewBody":"Fighting represents the new type of action film- no bang yet so boring. Not once did this film sneak up some excitement. It has some very dull characters played by some good actors that fail to give their characters some interest. For a film called Fighting, it has very little actual fighting until the last anti-climactic finale, which in all honesty, is quite boring. For an action film one can do much better, and not even the most brainless action fans will find this entertaining because for them it will have not enough action. So this film will please nobody... not enough action, no interesting plot or characters. Just another very forgettable action film like so many we have these days."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":32741,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2009-11-04","keywords":"boyfriend girlfriend relationship,counterfeiting,reference to billy joel,reference to merlin,reference to king arthur","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Fighting: Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1304560409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI1OTkyMDg5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjc4MjUyMg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI1OTkyMDg5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjc4MjUyMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In New York City, a young counterfeiter (Tatum) is introduced to the world of underground street fighting by a seasoned scam artist (Howard), who becomes his manager on the bare-knuckling brawling circuit. When a man goes in to have virtual vacation memories of the planet Mars implanted in his mind, an unexpected and harrowing series of events forces him to go to the planet for real - or is he?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0100802/","name":"Total Recall","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzU1YmJjMGEtMjY4Yy00MTFlLWE3NTUtNzI3YjkwZTMxZjZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDc2NjEyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a man goes in to have virtual vacation memories of the planet Mars implanted in his mind, an unexpected and harrowing series of events forces him to go to the planet for real - or is he?","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0100802/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Fella_shibby"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"A true science fiction action extravaganza.","reviewBody":"I first saw this in 1990 on a vhs i used to own. The film has lots of action, some violent scenes, good one liners n Arnie's fine acting at display. Surprisingly, this time he doesn't get to go shirtless or in a vest. The mutants mayb disturbing for some viewers. This was one of the earliest one to deal with a secret agent losing memory and all. programme.title: Evil Dead
Martwe zło
Evil Dead
programme.desc:
Evil Dead: Directed by Fede Alvarez. With Jane Levy, Shiloh Fernandez, Lou Taylor Pucci, Jessica Lucas. Five friends head to a remote cabin, where the discovery of a Book of the Dead leads them to unwittingly summon up demons living in the nearby woods." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1288558/","name":"Evil Dead","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzk2ZTVhOWMtMWQxYS00OWQzLWFmY2QtODQ4NGFmNGQxZWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Five friends head to a remote cabin, where the discovery of a Book of the Dead leads them to unwittingly summon up demons living in the nearby woods.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1288558/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"missmonochrome"},"dateCreated":"2013-04-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Only Evil Here Is That I Just Wasted $15","reviewBody":""The Evil Dead" suffers from the same malaise as many of the modern remakes of grindhouse/B Horror classics("I Spit On Your Grave", "Black Christmas" etc.). Rather than use the extra budget to fully realize the ideas and quirks that made the originals awesome......those buckets of cash are dumped into bloated, overlong run times and buckets of CGI blood sloshed about with a few surround sound sheer volume "jump" moments.

Unfortunately a lot of makes B horror classics special is the inventiveness forced by their sheer lack of budget.Concise runtimes born of necessity often kept things moving at a brisk pace, with out fluff or an excess of pointless padding.

Think about "The Beyond" and its glorious dime store surrealism, "Dead & Buried"'s layers of moody atmosphere, the weird quirk that managed to make people root for "The Human Centipede" to escape its scenery chewing creator....or in the case of "The Evil Dead" the fact that it was a horror film, but had a very good balance of black comedy, and Bruce Campbell had an excellent knack for knowing when to toss in a bit of a wink and a nudge. 

Granted, the original "Evil Dead" isn't nearly as camp/slapstick as its sequels...but it did have a sense of spiteful fun amongst all of the gore. 

The remake plays dead straight for so long, when it finally attempts a few brief moments of the original's laughs, they fall as flat as the actors' bland performances. 

It plods through the original plot pretty faithfully, and completely ignores the fact that the plot wasn't what made the original great. Demonic possession, the haunted cabin in the woods.....those were genre clichés in 1981, and they are more so 30 years later. 

Without the spirited ability to make fun of itself......."The Evil Dead" becomes a shadow of its former self, and the few spots where the remake changes essential plot elements only serve to make this ever more of a wad of ABC gum, with about as much flavor.

The protagonists die in the exact order you'd expect them to, and it all comes across as oddly perfunctory, with buckets of bile and a demon with a voice stolen straight from "The Exorcist" part of just another day at the office.

Additionally, for a $14,000,000 film, it's appallingly sloppy in a way that could easily been avoided with that much production budget. I can forgive a $1.50 and a shoestring film for plot holes, continuity errors and characters that are lifeless long before their on screen deaths. When it's a glossy Hollywood production the fact that all of the above happen often isn't homage.....it's just careless and lazy.

The few traditional special effects are ridiculously cheap and poorly done, and were clearly afterthoughts tossed in after the CGI budget line item ran out. Objects are broken, tossed aside or set on fire....only to necromance back to their original state a few frames later.

The modern "Evil Dead" committed the cardinal sin of a horror film. It was utterly boring. 

No one at my screening squealed, laughed or got grossed out by the added ultra violence.....we all just munched on our popcorn and let out a collective "meh" as the end credits rolled."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":163303,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror"],"datePublished":"2013-04-17","keywords":"demon,forest,zombie,fear,nurse","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"UK Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2732631577","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzMjY4NDkzOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODExODMzOQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzMjY4NDkzOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODExODMzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Five friends head to a remote cabin, where the discovery of a Book of the Dead leads them to unwittingly summon up demons living in the nearby woods. The evil presence possesses them until only one is left to fight for survival. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3994408/","name":"Jane Levy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2057036/","name":"Shiloh Fernandez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1140300/","name":"Jessica Lucas"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1793079/","name":"Fede Alvarez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0314851/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0116611/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1793079/","name":"Fede Alvarez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2140186/","name":"Rodo Sayagues"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000600/","name":"Sam Raimi"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

Rather than use the extra budget to fully realize the ideas and quirks that made the originals awesome......those buckets of cash are dumped into bloated, overlong run times and buckets of CGI blood sloshed about with a few surround sound sheer volume "jump" moments.

Unfortunately a lot of makes B horror classics special is the inventiveness forced by their sheer lack of budget.Concise runtimes born of necessity often kept things moving at a brisk pace, with out fluff or an excess of pointless padding.

Think about "The Beyond" and its glorious dime store surrealism, "Dead & Buried"'s layers of moody atmosphere, the weird quirk that managed to make people root for "The Human Centipede" to escape its scenery chewing creator....or in the case of "The Evil Dead" the fact that it was a horror film, but had a very good balance of black comedy, and Bruce Campbell had an excellent knack for knowing when to toss in a bit of a wink and a nudge. 

Granted, the original "Evil Dead" isn't nearly as camp/slapstick as its sequels...but it did have a sense of spiteful fun amongst all of the gore. 

The remake plays dead straight for so long, when it finally attempts a few brief moments of the original's laughs, they fall as flat as the actors' bland performances. 

It plods through the original plot pretty faithfully, and completely ignores the fact that the plot wasn't what made the original great. Demonic possession, the haunted cabin in the woods.....those were genre clichés in 1981, and they are more so 30 years later. 

Without the spirited ability to make fun of itself......."The Evil Dead" becomes a shadow of its former self, and the few spots where the remake changes essential plot elements only serve to make this ever more of a wad of ABC gum, with about as much flavor.

The protagonists die in the exact order you'd expect them to, and it all comes across as oddly perfunctory, with buckets of bile and a demon with a voice stolen straight from "The Exorcist" part of just another day at the office.

Additionally, for a $14,000,000 film, it's appallingly sloppy in a way that could easily been avoided with that much production budget. I can forgive a $1.50 and a shoestring film for plot holes, continuity errors and characters that are lifeless long before their on screen deaths. When it's a glossy Hollywood production the fact that all of the above happen often isn't homage.....it's just careless and lazy.

The few traditional special effects are ridiculously cheap and poorly done, and were clearly afterthoughts tossed in after the CGI budget line item ran out. Objects are broken, tossed aside or set on fire....only to necromance back to their original state a few frames later.

The modern "Evil Dead" committed the cardinal sin of a horror film. It was utterly boring. 

No one at my screening squealed, laughed or got grossed out by the added ultra violence.....we all just munched on our popcorn and let out a collective "meh" as the end credits rolled.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":163303,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror"],"datePublished":"2013-04-17","keywords":"demon,forest,zombie,fear,nurse","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"UK Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2732631577","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzMjY4NDkzOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODExODMzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzMjY4NDkzOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODExODMzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Five friends head to a remote cabin, where the discovery of a Book of the Dead leads them to unwittingly summon up demons living in the nearby woods. The evil presence possesses them until only one is left to fight for survival. programme.title: Night of the Living Dead
Noc żywych trupów
Night of the Living Dead
programme.desc: Night of the Living Dead: Directed by Tom Savini. With Tony Todd, Patricia Tallman, Tom Towles, McKee Anderson. When the unburied dead return to life and seek human victims, seven refugees seek shelter in a house in the Pennsylvanian countryside, but the group is at odds as to how they should deal with the situation." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0100258/","name":"Night of the Living Dead","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzYxZTE2ZWYtMGYxNS00OTFlLTkyYmMtYzVkZjI0ZTdmYzdkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When the unburied dead return to life and seek human victims, seven refugees seek shelter in a house in the Pennsylvanian countryside, but the group is at odds as to how they should deal with the situation.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0100258/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Backlash007"},"dateCreated":"2002-02-17","inLanguage":"English","name":""This is pure hell on earth."","reviewBody":""This is pure hell on earth." Actually, what Tony Todd meant to say was "This is one hell of a movie." Tom Savini and George A. Romero have succeeded in recreated a classic (which is quite hard to do). Night of the Living Dead '90 is faithful to the original, but still manages to scare and surprise you by throwing in a few unexpected twists. Director Savini creates a great atmosphere. This is one of my favorite claustrophobic films. It has the feel of an old, secluded farmhouse, and thankfully lacks that Hollywood gloss. The characters feel real as well. The cast is perfect. Tony Todd, William Butler, and Tom Towles are the re-incarnations of the original Ben, Tommy, and Harry Cooper. And longtime Romero collaborator, Patricia Tallman, revamps her character Barbara for the nineties. And you gotta love Bill Moseley ("They're coming to get you Barbara. They're horny Barbara."). All of the classic elements (the feud between Ben and Cooper, the claustrophobia) and a few new ones (a smarter female lead, new ending) make this one unforgettable."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":40797,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror"],"datePublished":"1990-10-19","keywords":"biker,friends who live together,multiple cameos,bald zombie,leather jacket","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Night of the Living Dead","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1298447129","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjk3MmViY2QtYTEzNC00NjcyLWFjY2QtZWU4MmZlY2UwZmY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjk3MmViY2QtYTEzNC00NjcyLWFjY2QtZWU4MmZlY2UwZmY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0865302/","name":"Tony Todd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0848191/","name":"Patricia Tallman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0869981/","name":"Tom Towles"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0767741/","name":"Tom Savini"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050229/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0751652/","name":"John A. The aftermath of a drug deal as told from three different points of view." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0139239/","name":"Go","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzJhNGExMDYtMWEyOS00MzMxLWJiYTYtMDYxNTRmNjdjM2VlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The aftermath of a drug deal as told from three different points of view.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0139239/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"socrates4"},"dateCreated":"2019-05-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Such Great Fun","reviewBody":"After PULP FICTION a lot of films tried to emulate its format. But none came close to matching its success. GO has clear elements of PULP FICTION in it, but it does its own thing at the same time. This is the right way to make a movie that may be inspired by another great film while still branching out on its own.\n\nThe story is great fun from the first frame to the last. The characters are fun and believable and there is a lot of great dialog here. Every time I watch it I continue to be impressed, even still after all these years. It never lets me down and it never once lets up even for a second. Highly recommend.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70095,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1999-04-09","keywords":"multiple storyline,multiple perspectives,drugs,drug deal,sex","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Go","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1655308569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDk5ZTIzM2MtMjU3MS00ZTgwLWJkYjEtODVmZDk0N2EyNGVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDk5ZTIzM2MtMjU3MS00ZTgwLWJkYjEtODVmZDk0N2EyNGVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001631/","name":"Sarah Polley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001542/","name":"Jay Mohr"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0937930/","name":"Scott Wolf"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510731/","name":"Doug Liman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060034/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0041864/","name":"John August"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

Stays true to it's narration and characters.","reviewBody":"Griffin and Dorff are great. They deliver. Music fits, camera works. Urban landscape is realistic and true. I' don't know, but this movie surprised me.

Ignore the sucky reviews such as, just because someone expects Hancock mainstream money making style of a movie and then gives it bad review cause of that. Or I liked this one: "It says comedy, but it's not, so I gave this movie a bad mark".

Loose the expectations. Nothing dramatic happens, but its realistic enough with good acting, music, shots and screenplay to make it a solid movie that doesn't fail at the end. It most definitely does not suck and subjective remarks like that should not be implemented.

Stays true to it's narration and characters.","reviewBody":"Griffin and Dorff are great. They deliver. Music fits, camera works. Urban landscape is realistic and true. I' don't know, but this movie surprised me.

Ignore the sucky reviews such as, just because someone expects Hancock mainstream money making style of a movie and then gives it bad review cause of that. Or I liked this one: "It says comedy, but it's not, so I gave this movie a bad mark".

Loose the expectations. Nothing dramatic happens, but its realistic enough with good acting, music, shots and screenplay to make it a solid movie that doesn't fail at the end. It most definitely does not suck and subjective remarks like that should not be implemented.

programme.title: Bone Eater
Zjadacz kości
Bone Eater
programme.desc:
Bone Eater: Directed by Jim Wynorski. With Bruce Boxleitner, Michael Horse, Adoni Maropis, Clara Bryant. Ancient Native American legend of the Bone Eater rises up and begins terrorizing the local townspeople." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0796306/","name":"Bone Eater","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MjE2MjI4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU5MTk5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ancient Native American legend of the Bone Eater rises up and begins terrorizing the local townspeople.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0796306/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"trashgang"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"just to see all those old actors again from the B-genre","reviewBody":"1986 brought us Chopping Mall from director Jim Wynorski, a classic in the genre. This here, Bone Eater won't be remembered. It contains a lot of very cheap and bad CGI but it's worth watching for the old thespians to see.

I guess that the budget went to the casting in stead of the effects. Main lead is by Bruce Boxleitner (Tron legacy (1982 and 2010)), but there are others to recogniz, Willam Katt from House (1986), Walter Koenig (from the Star Trak saga as Chekov),Veronica Hamel from Hill Street Blues (1981-1987) and Jim Storm from Dark Shadows (1966). 

The story itself was rather okay and the acting was also okay but the CGI teared it into a funny flick. To give you an example of cheap effects, the earthquakes were done by shaky camera's and you could easily see that the trees weren't moving. 

If you want to see the old brigade again than this is surely one to watch as a starter on a horror night with your pals. But if you think it will be a scary flick, forget it.

Gore 0/5 Nudity 0/5 Effects 0,5/5 Story 2/5 Comedy 0/5","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1227,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2008-02-09","keywords":"bone,worker,giant skeleton,relic,tomahawk","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000310/","name":"Bruce Boxleitner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0395398/","name":"Michael Horse"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0549538/","name":"Adoni Maropis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691061/","name":"Jim Wynorski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691061/","name":"Jim Wynorski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0486610/","name":"William Langlois"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0796306, Title: Bone Eater, --- Description: Bone Eater: Directed by Jim Wynorski. With Bruce Boxleitner, Michael Horse, Adoni Maropis, Clara Bryant. Ancient Native American legend of the Bone Eater rises up and begins terrorizing the local townspeople." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0796306/","name":"Bone Eater","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MjE2MjI4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU5MTk5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ancient Native American legend of the Bone Eater rises up and begins terrorizing the local townspeople.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0796306/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"trashgang","dateCreated":"2012-05-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"just to see all those old actors again from the B-genre","reviewBody":"1986 brought us Chopping Mall from director Jim Wynorski, a classic in the genre. This here, Bone Eater won't be remembered. It contains a lot of very cheap and bad CGI but it's worth watching for the old thespians to see.

I guess that the budget went to the casting in stead of the effects. Main lead is by Bruce Boxleitner (Tron legacy (1982 and 2010)), but there are others to recogniz, Willam Katt from House (1986), Walter Koenig (from the Star Trak saga as Chekov),Veronica Hamel from Hill Street Blues (1981-1987) and Jim Storm from Dark Shadows (1966). 

The story itself was rather okay and the acting was also okay but the CGI teared it into a funny flick. To give you an example of cheap effects, the earthquakes were done by shaky camera's and you could easily see that the trees weren't moving. 

If you want to see the old brigade again than this is surely one to watch as a starter on a horror night with your pals. But if you think it will be a scary flick, forget it.

programme.title: The Riverbank
Na brzegu rzeki
The Riverbank
programme.desc: The Riverbank: Directed by John L'Ecuyer. With Rick Roberts, Kenneth Welsh, Kari Matchett, Cindy Doire. A woman returns to her hometown following the death of her fathers second wife, which leads her to uncover dark family secrets." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2124973/","name":"The Riverbank","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWZlOGEyYzMtNTE3OS00NmEyLTgyZmUtZjMyZjE2NTIwM2Y4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY5MTYzNDA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman returns to her hometown following the death of her fathers second wife, which leads her to uncover dark family secrets.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2124973/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"phatandys"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Kari Matchett Reigns Supreme","reviewBody":"A really good movie. Of course Kari Matchett again hits it out of the ballpark with her usual aplomb, her performance alone is worth the time invested. But Kari didn't have to do all the heavy lifting because the casting of this movie is unusually strong. Inga Cadranel shined as she stood out among a really fine acting lineup, usually there is always at least one actor'ess/character who is unable to keep up but this movie's cast is really solid. Writing never lost track of the pace, nor insulted us with tropes, the mood was almost noir-like and I appreciated the writers not resorting to the easy-out way with their story. The direction was on a Hollywood feature level and the production levels were tops. You can tell those associated with this movie were pros. I have to say this again, if Kari Matchett is cast in a TV/Movie it is must see viewing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":109,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"genre":["Mystery"],"datePublished":"2012-10-03","keywords":"open marriage,family secret,flashback,two word title","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731519/","name":"Rick Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0920564/","name":"Kenneth Welsh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0558182/","name":"Kari Matchett"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0478286/","name":"John L'Ecuyer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0389034/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075779/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5249971/","name":"Genni Gunn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524905/","name":"Graham Ludlow"}],"duration":"PT1H16M"}</script><metacontent="

But Kari didn't have to do all the heavy lifting because the casting of this movie is unusually strong. Inga Cadranel shined as she stood out among a really fine acting lineup, usually there is always at least one actor'ess/character who is unable to keep up but this movie's cast is really solid. Writing never lost track of the pace, nor insulted us with tropes, the mood was almost noir-like and I appreciated the writers not resorting to the easy-out way with their story. programme.title: The Eye
Oko
The Eye
programme.desc: The Eye: Directed by David Moreau, Xavier Palud. With Jessica Alba, Alessandro Nivola, Parker Posey, Rade Serbedzija. Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0406759/","name":"The Eye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMyNjg3OTQyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjkyMzU1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0406759/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"robertallenandersonjr"},"dateCreated":"2008-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as bad as people make it sound","reviewBody":"The Eye was not a great movie but it's not horrible either. It was about an average movie. I was not expecting a lot going into seeing this movie. If you are expecting a lot going into this movie it will not be good but if your just looking to see a movie and thinking its going to be good you might actually like it. Pretty much the whole entire beginning and almost all of the middle was boring and just had very sudden scenes that would get you to jump out of your seat. The rest of the movie was when it started to kick up and get good. Jessica Alba finally started to find out what she had to do and what was going on with her and people around her. Thats when the action started and it had you on the edge of your seat. For the most part it was pretty slow moving and boring but then it kicked up it was good. If the first hour of the movie was like the end it would have of been an excellent movie. So if your looking for a pretty scary movie with lots of things that pop out at you go see this. The story was actually pretty good as well. The fact that it made you wait to find out why she became blind was well done. The acting job Jessica Alba did was good as well. The visual effects for this movie were also awesome.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52791,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-10-29","keywords":"corneal transplant,eye,violinist,eye transplant,seeing dead people","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Eye","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi263323929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Eye Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004695/","name":"Jessica Alba"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000205/","name":"Parker Posey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1219963/","name":"David Moreau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0658837/","name":"Xavier Palud"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179341/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012382/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0349406/","name":"Sebastian Gutierrez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1040327/","name":"Yuet-Jan Hui"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161152/","name":"Oxide Chun Pang"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

The rest of the movie was when it started to kick up and get good. Jessica Alba finally started to find out what she had to do and what was going on with her and people around her. Thats when the action started and it had you on the edge of your seat. For the most part it was pretty slow moving and boring but then it kicked up it was good. If the first hour of the movie was like the end it would have of been an excellent movie. So if your looking for a pretty scary movie with lots of things that pop out at you go see this. The story was actually pretty good as well. The fact that it made you wait to find out why she became blind was well done. The acting job Jessica Alba did was good as well. The visual effects for this movie were also awesome.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52791,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-10-29","keywords":"corneal transplant,eye,violinist,eye transplant,seeing dead people","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Eye","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi263323929","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Eye Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004695/","name":"Jessica Alba","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000205/","name":"Parker Posey"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1219963/","name":"David Moreau","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0658837/","name":"Xavier Palud"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179341/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012382/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0349406/","name":"Sebastian Gutierrez","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1040327/","name":"Yuet-Jan Hui","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161152/","name":"Oxide Chun Pang"],"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mr. Jones
Mr. Jones
programme.desc:
Mr. Jones: Directed by Mike Figgis. With Richard Gere, Lena Olin, Anne Bancroft, Tom Irwin. After being arrested during a manic episode, a man who suffers from bipolar disorder is treated by a psychiatrist who begins to develop romantic feelings towards him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107611/","name":"Mr. Jones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDczYzlhOGUtZGQ1ZS00NTg1LWE4MjEtY2VkNDIzZWQzODZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMwMjk0MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"After being arrested during a manic episode, a man who suffers from bipolar disorder is treated by a psychiatrist who begins to develop romantic feelings towards him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107611/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"clivy"},"dateCreated":"2005-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Something is happening here, but you don't know what it is, do you, Mr. Jones?","reviewBody":"I don't know very much about bipolar depression, aside from reading biographies of Robert Lowell, the poet. I have to say though that Richard Gere is outstanding in this movie. It started showing on ITV2 and his performance drew me into the story- I had to watch it to the end.

It's a brave premise for a Hollywood film but "Mr. Jones" is let down by a flawed script. I was offended by the way the doctor was portrayed. Of course she was played by a stunning actress, of course she became attached to her patient- to the point of invading his privacy by looking up his friends from his time at music college twenty years earlier. Oh, and of course (SPOILER- in more ways than one) she slept with him as well. She offers to resign which keeps her from being professionally ruined  sorry, but I can't see a qualified and experienced psychiatrist falling in love with her patient, let along sleeping with him while he's still under treatment. The ending peters out as well- to suggest that they will become a couple, I suppose.

The hospital scenes are strong and moving, as is the the subplot about the young student. This could have been an interesting study of people in emotional distress. Too bad they couldn't match Mr. Jones with unsentimental and uncompromising portraits of those trying to help him.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7114,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1993-10-08","keywords":"love,psychiatrist,bipolar disorder,concert,arrest","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000152/","name":"Richard Gere"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000565/","name":"Lena Olin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000843/","name":"Anne Bancroft"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001214/","name":"Mike Figgis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066604/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744839/","name":"Eric Roth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0188165/","name":"Michael Cristofer"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

After being arrested during a manic episode, a man who suffers from bipolar disorder is treated by a psychiatrist who begins to develop romantic feelings towards him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107611/","name":"Mr. Jones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDczYzlhOGUtZGQ1ZS00NTg1LWE4MjEtY2VkNDIzZWQzODZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMwMjk0MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"After being arrested during a manic episode, a man who suffers from bipolar disorder is treated by a psychiatrist who begins to develop romantic feelings towards him.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107611/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"clivy","dateCreated":"2005-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Something is happening here, but you don't know what it is, do you, Mr. Jones?","reviewBody":"I don't know very much about bipolar depression, aside from reading biographies of Robert Lowell, the poet. I have to say though that Richard Gere is outstanding in this movie. It started showing on ITV2 and his performance drew me into the story- I had to watch it to the end.

It's a brave premise for a Hollywood film but "Mr. Jones" is let down by a flawed script. I was offended by the way the doctor was portrayed. programme.title: The Fog
Mgła
The Fog
programme.desc: The Fog: Directed by John Carpenter. With Adrienne Barbeau, Jamie Lee Curtis, Janet Leigh, John Houseman. An unearthly fog rolls into a small coastal town exactly 100 years after a ship mysteriously sank in its waters." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0080749/","name":"The Fog","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmMwMWM1MWMtOGJlYS00NmIyLWI0MjYtNjJkNDI5OWQ2YjE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unearthly fog rolls into a small coastal town exactly 100 years after a ship mysteriously sank in its waters.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0080749/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BaronBl00d"},"dateCreated":"1999-11-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Creepy Atmosphere","reviewBody":"John Houseman sits around a campfire telling children about the story of a ship that went down near their home Antonio Bay and how the drowned sailors will reappear 100 years to that very night in the fog. It is a wonderful beginning to a very chilling film, directed by the modern horror meister John Carpenter. As with most of his films, Carpenter creates a scary atmosphere through moody settings(the California coastline, a lighthouse, an old Church), relentless mood music as in Halloween, good character acting(Holbrook, Houseman, Curtis, Leigh), and a claustrophobic feeling of something vice-like gripping you. The story has some plot problems, but none enough to detract from the overall enjoyment of the film. Adrienne Barbeau is as lovely as ever in the lead, and the film is credible amidst the background of supernatural actions."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":69528,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1980-02-08","keywords":"fog,ghost ship,lighthouse,navigator,sea","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer (4K Restoration)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1545648921","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjdjNWY3YzctYTQ5Yy00MmM3LTgzM2ItZWZiNmY2ZjQ1MDMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjdjNWY3YzctYTQ5Yy00MmM3LTgzM2ItZWZiNmY2ZjQ1MDMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unearthly fog rolls into a small coastal town exactly 100 years after a ship mysteriously sank in its waters."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000105/","name":"Adrienne Barbeau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000130/","name":"Jamie Lee Curtis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001463/","name":"Janet Leigh"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000118/","name":"John Carpenter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066770/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050464/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073430/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000118/","name":"John Carpenter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0384185/","name":"Debra Hill"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Halloween H20: 20 Years Later: Directed by Steve Miner. With Jamie Lee Curtis, Adam Arkin, Michelle Williams, Adam Hann-Byrd. Laurie Strode, now the dean of a Northern California private school with an assumed name, must battle the Shape one last time, as the life of her own son hangs in the balance." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120694/","name":"Halloween H20: 20 Years Later","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA3ZjMzZWItNWUyNy00ZmNiLWIwYmYtN2UxNWUwMGY5Yzc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Laurie Strode, now the dean of a Northern California private school with an assumed name, must battle the Shape one last time, as the life of her own son hangs in the balance.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120694/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"RyanCShowers"},"dateCreated":"2018-10-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Best Sequel of the Series","reviewBody":""Halloween H20" is the most accomplished sequel of the "Halloween" series, and a film that would deserve a "10" for its potency, conviction, and intelligence if it weren't for a few non-Laurie scenes earlier in the film that feel less than what other films achieved at the time. 

You can't talk about "Halloween H20" without discussing the impact the "Scream" trilogy had on this era in horror cinema. The post-modern references, thrilling and modern style, sexy stars, and heightened feminist protagonists that made the three "Scream" films so successful are borrowed by "Halloween H20" and are used to the film's triumph. 

The single best aspect of "Halloween H20" is Laurie Strode's character development. Though it's a bit more heavy-handed than Sidney in "Scream," it's effective, thorough, and aided by Jamie Lee Curtis' phenomenal, unforgettable portrayal. The last 20 minutes are first-rate 1990s horror. 

"Halloween H20" feels as scary and fresh today as it did in 1998."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70824,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1998-08-05","keywords":"slasher,call the police,private boarding school,faked death,headmistress","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Halloween H20: 20 Years Later","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1408212505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGUwNmY1MGUtMWM0ZS00NGQyLWE1OTUtMGIxOWZjOWU5YzA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGUwNmY1MGUtMWM0ZS00NGQyLWE1OTUtMGIxOWZjOWU5YzA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000130/","name":"Jamie Lee Curtis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001326/","name":"Josh Hartnett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0035060/","name":"Adam Arkin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0591171/","name":"Steve Miner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019626/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0091393/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005891/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0384185/","name":"Debra Hill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000118/","name":"John Carpenter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002526/","name":"Robert Zappia"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Halloween: Powrót
Halloween: Resurrection
programme.desc: Halloween. Kilkoro studentów ma spędzić noc w rodzinnym domu seryjnego mordercy, Michaela Myersa (Brad Loree). Całe zdarzenie będzie można oglądać na żywo w Internecie. Ten z uczestników, który dotrwa do rana, zwycięży. Wszyscy w znakomitych humorach udają się do ponurego domostwa, pewni, że czeka ich jedynie trochę strachu i mnóstwo dobrej zabawy. Nie wiedzą, że grozi im śmiertelne niebezpieczeństwo. Okazuje się bowiem, że Myers żyje i nie zamierza tolerować obecności intruzów.

credits.actor: Bianca Kajlich
Busta Rhymes
Thomas Ian Nicholas
Ryan Merriman
Daisy McCrackin
Katee Sackhoff
Luke Kirby
Tyra Banks
Sean Patrick Thomas

programme.title: Halloween 6: Przekleństwo Michaela Myersa
Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers
programme.desc: Haddonfield w Illinois. W przeszłości mieszkańcy miasteczka żyli w strachu przed psychopatycznym mordercą, Michaelem Myersem (George P. Wilbur). Od sześciu lat zarówno on, jak i jego siostrzenica Jamie nie dają znaku życia. Niespodziewanie Jamie wraca do miasta. Ucieka przed Michaelem. Próbuje ostrzec dr. Loomisa przed niebezpieczeństwem, zostaje jednak zabita. Wcześniej udaje jej się dodzwonić do lokalnej rozgłośni radiowej. Słyszy ją Tommy (Paul Rudd), który od lat tropi Myersa.

programme.title: Rise of the Zombies
Inwazja zombie
Rise of the Zombies
programme.desc:
Rise of the Zombies: Directed by Nick Lyon. With Mariel Hemingway, Ethan Suplee, LeVar Burton, Danny Trejo. When zombies overrun San Francisco, a desperate group survives by locking themselves inside Alcatraz Prison. When the undead breach the island, our heroes are forced to return to the mainland overrun with the undead." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2236182/","name":"Rise of the Zombies","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTc2OTM0MTE3NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTA2MzA1MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When zombies overrun San Francisco, a desperate group survives by locking themselves inside Alcatraz Prison. When the undead breach the island, our heroes are forced to return to the mainland overrun with the undead.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2236182/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nickelsdimes2077"},"dateCreated":"2013-03-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Worth watching ... for free","reviewBody":"The plot isn't anything new. And the execution is pretty typical. 

Mariel Hemmingway's acting was outright painful. Flat line delivery, and almost never with the proper emotion. Ethan Suplee isn't much better, but thankfully he doesn't have to say much. Lavar Burton is excellent, think the emotion of I Am Legend, without the kick-ass survivalist skills. By far the most noteworthy part of the movie. Danny Trejo is as Danny Trejo is, bad-ass. You won't be disappointed by him.

The effects are decent and the gore is quality. 

If you enjoy watching formulaic zombie action movies with little cinematic value, this will deliver.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3137,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-10-27","keywords":"zombie,alcatraz,scientist,mockbuster,san francisco bay","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Rise of the Zombies","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1530837529","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODlmMzY3ZWYtYWNmMy00NTY1LWJjODYtOTdjZWE1NGE5MjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODlmMzY3ZWYtYWNmMy00NTY1LWJjODYtOTdjZWE1NGE5MjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Rise of the Zombies"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000446/","name":"Mariel Hemingway"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0839486/","name":"Ethan Suplee"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000996/","name":"LeVar Burton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0528963/","name":"Nick Lyon"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042909/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0019969/","name":"Keith Allan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3226880/","name":"Delondra Mesa"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
Koszmar minionego lata
I Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: I Know What You Did Last Summer: Directed by Jim Gillespie. With Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Ryan Phillippe, Freddie Prinze Jr.. Four young friends bound by a tragic accident are reunited when they find themselves being stalked by a hook-wielding maniac in their small seaside town." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119345/","name":"I Know What You Did Last Summer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDI4ODJlNGUtNjFiMy00ODgzLWIzYjgtMzgyZTljZDQ2NGZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four young friends bound by a tragic accident are reunited when they find themselves being stalked by a hook-wielding maniac in their small seaside town.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119345/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"baumer"},"dateCreated":"1999-08-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"At least it's better than the sequel","reviewBody":"I like Kevin Williamson. Scream was a brilliant parody of horror films while being scary in its own right and Dawson's Creek is a great television show. But this film is just not that good. It's not scary. It's not well written or well thought out. There really was no reason for guy from Rosanne to get killed. He had nothing to do with it. And it is the same thing in the sequel, most of the cast has nothing to do with it either. I didn't find this flick scary in the least although the story at the beginning was interesting. It is blessed with a cast of incredibly good looking people but that does not make it a good film to watch. If you really enjoy seeing Love Hewitt running around with her breasts half exposed, Gellar looking particularly sexy, Phillipe trying to box, Prinze Jr. looking silly, stupid characters that do stupid things, unconvincing deaths, a trunk full of fish that conveniently disappears (smell and all) when it is required to, someone get a hair cut in their sleep without knowing it and a plethora of other really bad scenarios, then this is your movie. However, if you want to see a good horror flick with teenagers getting killed, rent the early Fridays, the first Halloween, the first Nightmare, the first Texas, the first Evil Dead and even Scream. But for God sake, stay away from this one. It is quite bad."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140089,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1997-10-17","keywords":"stupid victim,taking a shower,mystery killer,characters murdered one by one,part of trilogy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"I Know What You Did Last Summer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi663666457","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwMDBiYmQtZDJkNC00NjQxLTlkZWEtMzMyN2RkOTBkY2YxXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwMDBiYmQtZDJkNC00NjQxLTlkZWEtMzMyN2RkOTBkY2YxXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001349/","name":"Jennifer Love Hewitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001264/","name":"Sarah Michelle Gellar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000162/","name":"Anne Heche"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0318947/","name":"Jim Gillespie"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033437/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011134/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147895/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0242028/","name":"Lois Duncan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0932078/","name":"Kevin Williamson"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service: Created by Donald P. Bellisario, Don McGill. With Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Sean Murray, Pauley Perrette. The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mch2469-955-827475"},"dateCreated":"2014-03-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Things ain't what they used to be...!","reviewBody":"I started watching this series a few years after it started and went back through previous seasons to catch up...

Admittedly you need to suspend any sense of reality to enjoy this show as with many other similar shows... however thats a good thing as TV shows are about escaping and stepping into an alternate world...with alternate characters...

So with that in mind I have enjoyed the shows..... I was never a lover of Ziva character but it worked within the team of characters... a balance I guess you could say...

I have been watching since the new character to replace Ziva arrived and although as a character, Ellie really doesn't work for me.... the character itself isn't in line with the shows balance...

I know some reviews mention her traits and methods within the show... that to be honest isn't the problem for me... its the way that character sits within the team and ultimately the show.... as we all know every character is unrealistic and more of a caricature.... so this new character and her traits aren't for me the issue...its the way that particular character just doesn't work within the team and balance of the show.... by deliberately avoiding going for a similar character as Ziva the makers have tried to go a different way and to me it ain't worked.... I have seen a few guest characters that would work better and create good relationships and open more story lines... this character ain't one of them...I find myself forwarding her scenes to avoid the irritation her character brings...I have only found myself being irritated by one other character during the shows seasons and that is the Coast Guard Agent Borin she was terrible...so OTT at trying to be something she clearly couldn't be .... like some sort of female Gibbs character... she was really irritating both as a character and as the actress trying to play that role ... maybe a different actress would have made that work but certainly not Diane Neal...

I hope the makers of the show do change this new character..I can see myself drifting away from this show if they don't...

But then maybe the other side of the coin is that the show is not putting out the same level of episodes and story lines that it used to... and my dislike of that new character is more about the overall than just the that..?"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130580,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-23","keywords":"goth girl,babe scientist,special agent,naval criminal investigative service,police procedural","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001319/","name":"Mark Harmon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564724/","name":"David McCallum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615266/","name":"Sean Murray"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114905/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066107/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069074/","name":"Donald P. Bellisario"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1453745/","name":"Don McGill"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: The Eigth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi291414809","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDJiZmZiNGUtNWFhMi00MzM0LWEzMjAtMTM2NzMyYzQzMjg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDJiZmZiNGUtNWFhMi00MzM0LWEzMjAtMTM2NzMyYzQzMjg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for NCIS: The Eighth Season"}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0364845, Title: NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service, --- Description: NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service: Created by Donald P. Bellisario, Don McGill. With Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Sean Murray, Pauley Perrette. The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mch2469-955-827475","dateCreated":"2014-03-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Things ain't what they used to be...!","reviewBody":"I started watching this series a few years after it started and went back through previous seasons to catch up...

Admittedly you need to suspend any sense of reality to enjoy this show as with many other similar shows... however thats a good thing as TV shows are about escaping and stepping into an alternate world...with alternate characters...

So with that in mind I have enjoyed the shows..... I was never a lover of Ziva character but it worked within the team of characters... a balance I guess you could say...

I have been watching since the new character to replace Ziva arrived and although as a character, Ellie really doesn't work for me.... the character itself isn't in line with the shows balance...

I know some reviews mention her traits and methods within the show... that to be honest isn't the problem for me... its the way that character sits within the team and ultimately the show.... as we all know every character is unrealistic and more of a caricature.... so this new character and her traits aren't for me the issue...its the way that particular character just doesn't work within the team and balance of the show.... by deliberately avoiding going for a similar character as Ziva the makers have tried to go a different way and to me it ain't worked.... I have seen a few guest characters that would work better and create good relationships and open more story lines... this character ain't one of them...I find myself forwarding her scenes to avoid the irritation her character brings...I have only found myself being irritated by one other character during the shows seasons and that is the Coast Guard Agent Borin she was terrible...so OTT at trying to be something she clearly couldn't be .... like some sort of female Gibbs character... she was really irritating both as a character and as the actress trying to play that role ... maybe a different actress would have made that work but certainly not Diane Neal...

I hope the makers of the show do change this new character..I can see myself drifting away from this show if they don't...

But then maybe the other side of the coin is that the show is not putting out the same level of episodes and story lines that it used to... and my dislike of that new character is more about the overall than just the that..?","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130580,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-23","keywords":"goth girl,babe scientist,special agent,naval criminal investigative service,police procedural","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001319/","name":"Mark Harmon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564724/","name":"David McCallum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615266/","name":"Sean Murray"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114905/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066107/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069074/","name":"Donald P. programme.title: 13 Going on 30
Dziś 13, jutro 30
13 Going On 30
programme.desc: 13 Going on 30: Directed by Gary Winick. With Jennifer Garner, Mark Ruffalo, Judy Greer, Andy Serkis. A girl makes a wish on her thirteenth birthday, and wakes up the next day as a thirty-year-old woman." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0337563/","name":"13 Going on 30","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE1NzI5NTkwMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwOTA4NzY2._V1_.jpg","description":"A girl makes a wish on her thirteenth birthday, and wakes up the next day as a thirty-year-old woman.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0337563/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jmazznyc"},"dateCreated":"2018-05-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"I Never Realized what a Schmuck I Actually Am","reviewBody":"Until I forced myself to sit down and watch this entire movie. Completely prepared to despise it after reading all the negative reviews; but am a big Ruffalo fan, and have always liked Jennifer Garner. After the first 20 minutes, my tv remote channel change button was almost completely pressed until Michael Jackson's huge "Thriller" party number commenced. Admittedly, I'm a big '80's fan; which of course factored into my thorough enjoyment of this flick! Madonna, Pat Benatar hits...awesome dude!! Honestly Ruffalo and Garner had great chemistry and gave sweet performances. Any movie that makes me laugh and cry is a keeper. No spoilers; but if you loved "Big" (who didn't...and yes a better movie), you will also love "13". You'll just need to give it a little time :)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":178063,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-09-01","keywords":"wish,13th birthday,30 year old,body swap,body transformation","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"13 Going on 30","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2209546521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0ZmQ2MjMtYmFkOC00Y2FhLTkzZTAtNWExMjhmZTZjMGQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0ZmQ2MjMtYmFkOC00Y2FhLTkzZTAtNWExMjhmZTZjMGQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004950/","name":"Jennifer Garner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0749263/","name":"Mark Ruffalo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0339460/","name":"Judy Greer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0935095/","name":"Gary Winick"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0107045/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0326092/","name":"Josh Goldsmith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0951135/","name":"Cathy Yuspa"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="
